text:
So far it is a dud! The hostess was MIA for five minutes but we were finally seated. Jennifer, our server did finally show up as well.  
Waiting for the food. Hopefully will be a little quicker. Stay tuned
The coffee was good once it showed up. My wife's burger was nuked and went back. It was ok the second time. My chicken was very oily and the breast was dry.

The best part of the meal was the pretzels. Outstanding!

I would not return.

My husband and I recently stayed at the Encore at the Wynn so we decided to have breakfast/brunch one morning at Jardin. The decor and service were both lovely. My husband had the short rib sliders and enjoyed them. I ordered the maine lobster benedict. There is no egg I love in this world more than a poached egg. Well I received 2 hard eggs on my benedict. I know poaching eggs is an art, however, at this calibur of restaurant there is no excuse for improperly poaching an egg. Honestly for the prices at this restaurant I would not recommend anyone to go here. I do not mind spending $30 on a nice properly prepared brunch for myself. I do mind spending that much when the food is not prepared properly.

Another great breakfast. No wait for a table. Service was super fast and my waitress,Veronique was very nice. Even inquired as to if the glassware was available in the home store and she found the website of the distributor for me. Had the Lobster Benedict which comes with a very generous portion of lobster. This is quickly becoming a go to breakfast place on each trip.
I've had breakfast here for 4 straight days - the service is good, the atmosphere is very relaxed and inviting and the food is better than the other options around Wynn/Encore.

Food here is total ripped off. I spent $30 bucks for sea scallop dish that came with only 3 scallops a little bigger than mine thumb. It's tasted normal. Luckily it came with some bread and a couple glasses to help filled up my stomach. If paid just for the decoration then it's ok otherwise should eat first before come here.
Terrible. Don't bother. Does not compare to the former amazing Society Cafe. :(. Plastic cups to bring your wine to go??  Fake flowers. So cheesy.

A bit of a cluster getting our table but overall, good food and service. Pretty restaurant. Music on the loud side making it a little difficult to hear. Not sure why it was so loud as the restaurant was not busy when we sat down at 7:00.

What a great new restaurant at Encore! My family loved it especially the chocolate cake in the edible terra-cotta pot that looked so real! I had the tempeh entree which tasted great. Can't wait to come back in the summer it's right next to the resort pool

Decent food & horrible service. When we arrived, the place was 80% empty. It took them 15 minutes to seat us at a table. Then when we sat down, took another 10 minutes just for the server to come get drink orders. We had to ask for check 4 times with 4 different people to get it. Also realized when we were walking out that everyone had bread on their tables and we were never even offered bread. Never going back, would not recommend it. Much better places to eat at the Wynn

We went for breakfast -- so disappointed that Wynn/Encore closed Society Cafe its previous breakfast place.  The good -- food and service.  We were able to order a traditional bacon and egg breakfast, off menu - just ask!  Service was excellent.  The chairs are comfortable.  The negative.  The acoustics are terrible -- I mean terrible -- you can hear everyone's cutlery clinking.  The food is overpriced.
This place is a solid choice. Good food and service. Great room and space. Would return.
Good steak. Ran of wagu steak on Tuesday  nite.  Came medium when ordered medium rare. Decent , but 3 stars at most.
Worst restaurant in Wynn. Horrible service. Love the other restaurants in Wynn. Maybe just Sunday night is horrible.

From a Celiac:

** I never like to complain about service, but since this was so horrific- at a STEVE WYNN property, AND the food was bad, I have to mention it.

I was SO excited about trying this place because of reading the great story in the Wynn magazine about the new chef bringing fresh new flavors. We had always joked about the previous restaurant- Boterrible. It was Boterro, but we had to rename it because the food was so bad. The new renovation is beautiful, with fresh flowers, lighter colors, same amazing location. That is the extent of the redeeming qualities.

The Menu:
Wynn restaurant pretty much all have allergen menus. Not this place. In fact, our stupid waitress didn't even know what gluten was. (I should've gotten up and left, since I was still recovering from unknowingly being served gluten at Allegro two weeks ago) I digress...

Wine:
Wine? Where... where is it? Oh, the server took a lap around the property and 30 minutes later she brought the bottle. Didn't know how to open it. Then never poured one more drop for the whole meal. This is one of my boyfriends biggest pet peeves. He wants the server to pour the wine. 

Appetizers:
After asking a few questions, having the dumb server return from the kitchen a few times and  STILL not knowing what she was doing, we finally got appetizers, cold and wrong, but at least the boyfriend got some bread, with no butter, to eat with his self poured wine. 

There was literally not one dish on the menu that looked appetizing to either of us. I just ordered sides- gross. Boyfriend orders a steak, which was not cooked correctly. 

Dessert:
Really bland, had no distinguishable flavors. Server leaves for the night.

Waiting......


Waiting.....


Last ones in the restaurant. We didn't mind because we both enjoy each others company, so we were in no hurry. Manager comes over and firmly tells us that we need to leave because the restaurant is closed. I interrupt and couldn't help but snapping at her that we hadn't even received a bill yet. It wasn't even that late, yet the manager chose to be SO unprofessional to ask us to leave. And we hadn't even been given a bill yet. I was FUROUS by this point. I try not to get mad at dinner, but all combined with this rudeness was inexcusable. All the servers and managers were dumb, lazy, ignorant of the menu, didn't know what gluten was, couldn't open a wine bottle, didn't know how to pour a wine bottle. When 2 people spend $500 on a meal and then have to complain about service, that is a MAJOR problem. 

Boyfriend and I come to Vegas often and going to awesome dinners is the highlight. He let me choose this place because I'd been going on and on about it for weeks, wanting to try it. Not only do I not want him to have a bad time at dinner, I want him to keep letting me pick new restaurants! This was a major blemish on my restaurant selection track record. 

Other reviews on Open Table also talked mainly about poor service. Didn't really see it here on Yelp though.

We stay at Encore sometimes 2-3 times a month. It's nice to eat at the property sometimes, but I will never go back to this disaster. Not even to order a to-go order to eat at the pool.

Fantastic restaurant. Ambience, food and service. As the name suggests it looks like a beautiful garden! 
Not too count the delicious and unique flower pot chocolate cake desert. Truly a work of art. Will be back over and over!

Nice to see they offer vegan dishes!  I tried the white bean soup which was tasty. I also tried the coconut curry tempeh entree. I'm from Detroit and you don't see this in many restaurants back home so was excited to try it.  It was good but unfortunately a bit bland which was a bit disappointing. Other than that the restaurant was nice and would go back.

Came here for dinner as a party of 4.

Took about 10 minutes to be seated, despite there being no-one else waiting and the restaurant being only around one third full.

The place was very nice. Server was very enthusiastic and friendly. We only ordered entrees, which took around 45 minutes to arrive!

Unfortunately, once the food got there, it was ordinary at best. My steak (Rib Eye) was ok - but it was $45 for what would have been a $20 steak elsewhere.

Other people with me had the Fried Chicken (overcooked, not much flavour), the Organic Salmon (overcooked) and Turkey Burger (dry, not much flavour).

I wouldn't recommend this place for dinner at all. Maybe it's ok for breakfast/brunch, but it failed to deliver for us.
What an amazing room! The food was great, the service was spot-on. We were treated like celebrities!

My husband and I stumbled upon this restaurant in the Encore hotel. We were going to the hotels checking out all of the Christmas decorations and while walking around we saw this restaurant. The ambience is romantic, you can dine inside or outside. 

The hostess greeted us with a warm, friendly smile; we did not have a reservation but we were able to get seated. 

Our waitress, Amira was very friendly, her customer service was excellent. I asked her a few questions about the menu and she was knowledgeable about each dish and recommended the Branzino. It was very delicate and flavorful, I enjoyed it so much. I also ordered a side of the Brussel sprouts which were amazing (also recommended by Amira). My husband ordered the salmon and that was cooked to perfection, he ordered from the prix fixed menu. 
 Overall, we had an excellent dinner and superb service, to top it off the manager stopped by our table to speak with us and inquired about our meal and we talked about the flower decorations in the restaurant and he recommended us to see the decorations at the Wynn hotel. Beautiful evening!!

Love love  love this place. Went twice on our visit with the same waiter "Chuck" he's efficient , pleasant & handsome the food was exceptional and very fairly priced.. 
The food and ambiance is beautiful.

A great restaurant. I really appreciate their delicious healthy options. The kale salad on the dinner menu was fabulous. Also excellent: their Buffalo Cauliflower appetizer. Fabulous, unusual, and I will order these items again and again!! 

A beautiful atmosphere: flowers everywhere.

Service was attentive, professional, warm, and knowledgeable. 

I would have liked a more extensive cocktail menu. And their whiskey pours were pretty short.

Not cheap, but I thought a reasonable price for the high quality.  

We also had breakfast here: the lemon ricotta pancakes weren't very good: they were super bland, and came with fake chemical maple syrup instead of the real stuff. Make sure to specify to get the real! 

I'll be back!! Hoping they continue to improve this already great place.

a poolside breakfast with amazingly kind servers? sounds like my kind of vacation meal!
we ate here for breakfast twice, and i especially loved the house made granola in the mixed berry parfait. my family loved the other dishes we ordered (as seen in the pictures), and we ended up grabbing breakfast there for both days i dropped in. 
would i typically pay this price for these dishes? no, but it is a vegas resort!

The best kept secret in Vegas
Amazing Chicken Meatballs.  Great surf and turf, try the Flower pot for dessert it was awesome.  The Penne pasta was great, and so was the pretzel bread!  Every thing was great
Never going back. The server was rude and racist. It's a good thing I was preoccupied while breastfeeding my son. Had it been a different day, I would have asked for a talk with the manager.

Alright so I love this place! Lol.... been a long time patron of the Encore since it opened and have tried all restaurants on the Wynn and Encore properties. Been coming here since it was Botero and to be honest I was quite disappointed when Botero was pulled out. But I've been enjoying Jardin ever since. I've never had a disappointing meal, drink, or service. Some must haves are the crispy buttermilk chicken sandwich and anything breakfast! They have an amazing Bloody Mary cart that comes around and makes your Bloody Mary to your exact specifications. Had the pleasure of Rick helping my group and I, superb service! Seriously amazing. Enjoy!

It was alright, food was overhyped, service could have been better. Didn't really appreciate getting kicked out by Erica. Really? After spending $300 and asked to leave. Customer is always WRONG! Sorry, try another restaurant...

Exceptional service, food, staff and ambience!!! We arrived in Friday to start a birthday weekend and went straight to Jardin for late lunch. Amazing pasta with stumps, salmon and salad!!! Fresh baked pretzel bread was melting in your mouth. Definitely will come back on my next trip!!

Food was dissapointing here, been coming to wynn/encore for many years and I'm used to top notch food from every restaurant here. This was just average, nothing special. First dissapointing dining experience here, out of 50 or 60 that I've had.

I am staying at the hotel and came down here because it seemed like a really nice spot to have lunch outside by the pool after a very long flight. The venue itself is really pretty but the service I received wasn't  the best. I expected more considering the location. It was not busy at all but my waitress forgot my drink and then wasn't around for about 15 minutes after I had been  done eating and was looking for the check. The food is good but my experience was nothing special and not worth the price.

Pretty fancy restaurant especially since its across the walk way to Hermès lol. There's a dress code- no tank tops for men but they will accommodate you to the outside patio , which was fine. The waiter was really nice and professional even though we were kind of tipsy and being annoying. I thought it was fancy how the popcorn chicken came with actual popcorn(never seen this before). The green pizza was great as well; who could've thought that a pizza with no meat could taste so delicious. The food was great i just wished the waiter told us about their gratuity fee. I always thought that was a requirement.

Jardin recently opened at Encore, having replaced Botero and Society Cafe. The cuisine is essential Society Cafe, but more elegant and less casual, but in all honesty, everything at Wynn/Encore isn't casual. If you remember Society Cafe, you'll notice the plate ware and flatware are the same! (Save where you can right? :P) The food was all amazing, as was expected. The service was lacking just a smidgen but that could've been because our waitress was training someone else. The only hiccup was that she mistakenly switched our crab legs for another crab dish, and by the time the crab legs were ready, the rest of the meal came out. 

For cocktails, they have a full bar of course but also a Mule Cart going around the restaurant making Moscow Mules and their mixed mules were amazing. We ordered the orange and it was great! We ended up ordering another each time he came around! If you have a big party, he can make a big one that services 16! For appetizers we had a flatbread which was basically an entire pizza. We expected a small rectangular size with maybe 4 small pieces total, but this was a full on pizza. But delicious nonetheless. As I said, we also got the King Crab legs. However, these weren't the same as you'd find in the buffet. My photo will show it's 2 tiny pieces already taken out of the legs. It was delicious but not expected. For our entrees, we ordered the oven baked prawns, which came on a bed of rice. There were about 6 prawns, decent size and deliciously seasoned. The rice was a bit al dente for me. We also ordered the short rib ravioli which was apparently great. However, you get like 5 raviolis. We had to get a side order of the oven baked mac and cheese which was a huge side order but delicious. And of course, what we were so excited to try was the potted planter chocolate cake. Everything is edible. You break open the pot and there you'll find the most decadent, non-overwhelming cake with dark chocolate mousse. A must try! But not just for one. We were 2 people and we couldn't finish it. Overall an 8/10 based on price vs. quantity ratio. Would go back just for the Moscow Mules and the cake!

I gave a 2 mainly because they are such assholes here in the front.  We moved our Xmas family dinner from 6:00  to 4:00 so we could have an earlier dinner and watch the football game.  When we arrived at 4 we were given a limited menu and told that we could not have a steak or the prime rib Xmas special but only a limited lunch menu.  They said we would have to come back in an hour if we wanted dinner (after we already had drinks and tried to order). We were annoyed but agreed to do that so we could have a real dinner.  We went to the front to insure we could have a table in an hour and we were told they were fully booked and we would not be able to get a table tonight.  Such BS and what a poor way to treat guests of Encore who stay here every year.  We were told they were booked solid the rest of the night, you would think if someone was calling to change their dinner reservation up they would tell you you can't have dinner at that time slot.   The girl at the front was extremely rude.  Well we decided to stay and sit for an hour and stair at each other since it was impossible to get a reservation anywhere in Xmas day. 

The dinner was outstanding, pricey but you get what you pay for.  The prime rib was cooked perfectly, the mashed potatoes that accompanied them were superb as well.   The lobster pasta was decadent and the truffle pizza appetizer with the poached egg was to die for.  Our server Roger was outstanding as well.  However because of the rude service and seemingly unorganized front end we will probably never dine here again.  Additionally the tables around us were never seated and for the most part the restaurant was less then half the entire time we were there.  They could have sat us an hour later with no problem.



Shame on you Steve Wynn and Jardin.  Last time we will ever go in there.

Came here late after a Cirque show. Wonderful service and best meal I had in a long time. Attention to detail, exquisite flavors and cooked perfectly. Amazing decor and atmosphere for a romantic evening. Will definitely be back here!
I really enjoy the quiet yet stimulating atmosphere here. It's sophisticated and the spicy Dirty Bloody Mary is really good. It's the spiciest I've ever had. :)

If you ask them nicely they will make their "chicken & waffles" which was by far the most amazing breakfast I've ever had in Vegas!!!

But be warned - if you want to brunch you absolutely need reservations.
Incredible food, staff, and quality. Will be coming back for sure!

Ok, even just for the pretzel bread that is served, you should come here. To die for! I could eat it all day! 
The yellowtail sashimi appetizer is delicious as well as the avocado salad! 
Service is great ... 
Moscow mules, made table side and DELICIOUS! Yes please! Would totally come back!

Came In for dinner last night for restaurants week. I had my hopes up for this place. The host was very nice as soon as we walked in we got greeted, but once we sat down our waiter was very rude! We waited long for our drinks and once we got our drinks it took for ever for her to get our order. At first we thought it was because she had a group of 6 she had to attend but once another couple got sited next to us she was sooo sooo nice to them she got there drinks and order. we weren't getting our food when they had there appetizers and wine. I don't understand why the difference between that group and us!! I don't want to say racism but she made it clear who was important to her. I don't think we're going to go back to get treated worse than a fast food restaurant!!!
Super classy and amazing service from our waitress! The menu and cocktail selection is great with tons of variety to choose from.

We came to Le Jardin at The Wynn on Monday night for a business event - dinner with 30 clients - and we were truly amazed by the quality of the service, from the decor to the food without forgetting the friendliness of the waiters and waitresses. We had to add a few people last minute and change the seating plan and the staff was very helpful, accommodating each of our request. We had a memorable night there and would definitely recommend / go back.

I went with 2 friends and it was a nightmare for his type of restaurant : service too low, wine and water was not served after he first glass, the dessert was a pudding on the menu but in real it was a strange cream....

I don't recommend this place sorry for the price it's too expensive for this bad service.

Just love this place! Been here several times both for a date night and night out with a big group of girl friends.  The service has always been kind and attentive. The design is also amazing with beautiful flower arrangements, nice decor and classy set up.  

I have had a lot of items on the menu and so far,  the favorites have been the steak, Mac and cheese bites, and truffle pizza. You really can't go wrong with anything, though.  

Price is expected for a high end steakhouse in Vegas at the best hotel on the strip. You gotta love it!

The best breakfast and service I have ever had in my life! The restaurant was recommended to us by my family members who were in Las Vegas two weeks before I was. We asked to sit outside, and the view was spectacular. They have outside heaters so year round outside should be your pick. The beautiful pool and landscaping is worth the price. My husband likes coffee...but does not love it...and he said it was the best he ever had. I had the pancakes. They were to die for...I will dream about them for a long time. My husband had the salmon and bagel breakfast and he loved every bite. And then the service...PHENOMENAL!!!

5 stars-- As good as it gets!!!
If you're dining in Las Vegas, you would be absolutely amiss to skip on experiencing Jardin at the Wynn/Encore. Experience it you must!

My Love and I have been here twice in the past month for the fine cuisine and expertise of Jardin Executive Chef Joe Zanelli. We are quite the foodies and tend to be particular about dining out (especially on the Las Vegas Strip.) These two experiences at Jardin were THE.BEST.FINE.DINING.EXPERIENCE. OF. OUR. LIVES. Truly, truly, truly. 

Let me tell you more...

We were greeted at the restaurant entrance by name, which was a 5-star touch on it's own.

The food. I don't even have enough time to write about the spectacular array we feasted upon. Just try what speaks to your appetite! For dessert, you cannot skip that pot of chocolate cake; it's culinary divinity.  

The service is next-level. If you want the best of the best, you must DEMAND Chuck be your server. Chuck at Jardin is the epitome of fine dining service and boy, does he set the bar high. Ask for him specifically and you'll see what I mean. The rest of the wait staff attended to our table like a well-orchestrated symphony. 

The atmosphere is ideal for fine dining. The sound level is perfection; I loved that I couldn't hear anyone else's conversation. Jardin (translated to garden) is beautifully garden-themed, from a giant floral centerpiece in the dining room, to edible flower garnishes in the cocktails, to an edible flower pot dessert (again, a MUST-TRY) and the luxe flower garden and pool in the outside courtyard. 

If you have an appreciation for all the aforementioned, definitely experience the gastro magic at Jardin.
Great food, gray ambience, Gabe took good care of me

My husband and I made a reservation here for my birthday dinner and we couldn't be happier with our decision. We were seated promptly and everybody was very attentive. We had Wayne as our waiter and he made sure everything was to our liking the entire night. We never felt rushed and our drinks were always full. For the appetizer we ordered the meatballs which were really good. For our entree, I ordered the short ribs with a size of the truffle Mac & cheese bites and my husband ordered the prime rib. Everything was very tasty,especially the mac  &cheese bites. They were so rich I loved them! For dessert we had to try the flower pot cake which was perfect. The balance of sweetness between the chocolate mousse layers with the chocolate and raspberry filling was perfection. We would definitely come back here to try their other menu options for brunch/lunch! Great experience overall.

Amazing breakfast in the Encore, very bright and colorful decor, service was amazing, espresso very good combined with their Dirty Mary, a Bloody Mary with olive juice and blue cheese stuffed olives (they have five different types of Bloody Mary cocktails. All entrees we decided to split to taste as much as possible. Chicken omelette substituted with egg whites was fantastic! Jack cheese peppers topped with a generous amount of avocado, their hash brown potatoes are small but incredible. Maine lobster Benedict was incredible eggs cooked to perfection and hollandaise sauce was on point and the sautéed spinach was a nice accompaniment. French toast came with caramelized apples on top I was a little apprehensive about because it looked like someone reached into a loaf of bread and decided to make it out of wonder bread. It was fantastic, maple custard and bacon was a pleasant surprise all in all one of the best I have ever had!!  I considered closing the meal with an antioxidant smoothy but I choose to just order pomegranate juice.

Just wonderful.  The food was exceptional!  The quality, the selection, the taste, I was so impressed.  And reasonable- for Vegas. Our waitress, Veronique, was excellent.  Do yourself a favor and skip the buffet and eat a wonderfully prepared healthy meal.  Don't skip the chocolate flower pot cake -amazing and beautiful ($18 but it feeds 4).  It was the best meal in Vegas I have had in years

Wonderful place to eat and enjoy your meal. We went for dinner and it was amazing. Decent price and very cool atmosphere, I had the short ribs which was the most tender I have ever had. My husband had the filet and said it wad also very good. Lastly the bread pudding dessert is a must. We live in vegas so we will definitely come back. Yum!!

A pleasant, but nothing special restaurant. Was relaxing, an important attribute in Vegas. Reminded me of a restaurant at a Disney resort. The best thing were the chicken meatballs, which were really tasty.

I have to say this may have been the best dining experience I ever had.

My friend had reserved the table for us in the event of a huge crowd and I arrived 5 minutes later and already had water and waiter was all set to introduce himself. Shortly after taking our order he brought out complimentary pretzel sticks which I thought were unbelievably delicious. 

The best part of the experience was the view. We had an outdoor table and it was right next to the pool giving a wonderful vibe.

The food was delivered 13 minutes after we ordered and was fantastic. The waiter always kept coming back to check on us and refill our water which was great because it was quite hot.

In short the experience was nothing short of perfect and I would be willing to dine there in future trips to Las Vegas.

So pleased with the service ! I have a hard time traveling due to my allergies. It's hard to find restaurants that take them seriously . They were so friendly and even presented it in foil so that my salmon didn't get any cross contamination. I'll be back the rest of my stay at the wynn. Thank you Scott, Chef Zannelli and Rick !

Dinner at Jardin was hands down our favorite meal during our short visit to Las Vegas. I ordered from their pre fixed menu since the choices were exactly what I would have wanted to order on their al a carte menu. My appetizer was a crab cake, entree filet mignon cooked perfectly to my specifications. It also included a choice of 2 desserts.  We were there to see Le Reve and didn't mention it to our server until we ordered dessert. He was able to request the kitchen to rush it since we only had 20 minutes to our show time.  My dessert was a warm berry crostada that was cooked to order. It was amazing.   I wish I had more time to relax and eat the whole thing but it was our fault for not letting the server know earlier of our time constraint.  Definitely go to this restaurant. Our server was amazing (I wish I remembered his name) along with all the other wait staff that was servicing our table.  We sat by the window overlooking the pretty pool area.

Food was OK, but unbelievably overpriced for breakfast. For the price, it should have been perfect and just wasn't. They forgot to bring out my brother-in-laws OJ. I ordered the lox benedict that was just way too overpowered by the avocado. Could have used more lox, less avocado. Everyone else enjoyed their food, but honestly, nothing that great.

Jardin is a great lunch destination and I would definitely recommend. The atmosphere is garden-like and bright. Our wait staff was pleasant and extremely efficient. 

My daughter ordered a chicken sandwich as did I. I found the chicken to be juicy, tender and perfectly seasoned. My cousin ordered some egg contraption from the menu. I'm not exactly sure what it was, but she enjoyed it. 

I've noticed some previous reviews complain about the portion sizes here. Bah! I found the portions to be perfect, and I was full at the end of my meal. While some chain restaurants out there pump out huge extra, extra large sizes of subpar food - I appreciated the appropriate sized portion of food that was well flavored at Jardin.

The adult beverages we had were good. However, they only serve margaritas on the rocks - not blended - which I thought was a bummer.

Overall, a good experience and delicious food. We will definitely return.

This is my second time I visit this place. Both times with reservations and both times reservations were hold with credit card. But some how you have to wait 15-30 min before they will have your table ready. Food is average. Lobster Benedict and Burgers are good. Drinks are  way expensive, but good presentation when you order Bloody Mary. Service is really slow and frustrating . If you in rush to explore Vegas, don't go this place.

Very disappointing experience we had at the Jardin restaurant. We checked in at the Encore hotel on 10/17/17 and decided to go for lunch to Jardin restaurant.
We ordered tune poke which is raw fish; kale salad and desert. Me and my girlfriend got sick right after lunch. Had to to drug store buy medicine.
The pain and discomfort didn't go away; I called the manager hours later lunch explained what happened he's said he has to call security to file report. Manager didn't ask what we ate and didn't offer to take off the bill.
Security came to the room and file report and that's it. I checked out on 10/19/17 and had to pay for Jardin restaurant which we got sick from.
I was very surprised that five star hotel and restaurant have these standards and don't take care of their customers. The only thing manager called and said that they did investigation and nothing was wrong with fish. Sounded like they didn't believe us that we got sick from eating their food.
I was very disappointed and never will return to Jardin restaurant.
Nothing on the menu really appealed to me. Got the chilled shrimp. Would NOT recommend unless you want to feel like super salty.

This was our first time in the Encore and we came here yesterday for lunch and were seated right away. They weren't very busy which was great and the place had a nice vibe. But we waited for a least 10 minutes for someone to come to the table. A waitress came to tell us someone would be with us in a minute, and then we waited some more. We thought about just walking out but then a waiter finally came. He was good, but honestly we won't be going back. The food wasn't the greatest, it was just okay and the waiter was good but the waiting around kind of blew it for us. I have feeling he wasnt supposed to have our table in the first place. When you pay that amount for food, everything from the minute you walk in to the minute you leave should be outstanding.
Completely overpriced for overly salty food and slow service. You're better off with the other casual dining options at the Wynn/Encore such as Red 8 and Wazuzu.

This restaurant had good food and a unique ambiance. Our waiter was spectacular and friendly. They went out if their way to make sure my flax allergy was taken care of. The manager came over and was gracious also. I would have to say the reason I am not giving it 4 or 5 stars is because we sat outside on a beautiful night na dhad people smoking around us while we are. When the hostess asked if we wanted to sit outside she should have informed us. I did not expect this in such an upscale place to eat. I would go again but probably sit inside.

Came here twice for breakfast and really enjoyed it ! Food was really good. I ordered the pancakes for my son and I stole a few bites and they were soooo good !! One morning I ordered chicken avocado omelet. Mehhh. It was okay. The potatoes were good and bacon was cooked perfectly ! The second time for breakfast I ordered a different omelet - I think like veggie or ham/onion/cheese and thought it was much better. 
Oj was freshly squeezed and delicious. Also had an iced coffee/latte and was pretty good too. 

Service was good and the place was clean. They had crayons and a kids menu to keep my son entertained for a little bit and provided plastic ware for my son to use as well which was nice and thoughtful. Would recommend coming back here !

We stayed in town this Christmas and decided to go to Jardin for a Christmas brunch. It was crowded but we never waited long to be served. My husband and I both agreed the food was perfect, not like normal breakfast food. It wasn't greasy and it wasn't over or under seasoned. It was perfect. 
My daughter got the hot chocolate and loved it, there was nothing left. She also had the 3 egg breakfast, the bacon was crisp to perfection. My husband had the Maine  lobster Benedict and I went with the kale scramble with pain au chocolate( chocolate croissant). 
Overall it was wonderful and all the fresh flowers were bea
I would love to return and try dinner next!

We dined here again for dinner. The ambiance was very nice, the lighting was low and service just as good. All our food came out in a good amount of time and it was perfect. We all loved the truffle fries, we love truffle everything. There were three of us and together we could not finish the flower pot cake. It was so moist and delicious.

One star for not making it past the bar due to the rude 38ish yr old grouchy haggard blonde bartender behind the bar (nothing against females of an age as I am one-I'm just angry at her bad representation of a female server). Four of us sat down about 7:30 pm on 9/13 for a refreshment while we pondered going into the dining room for dinner. The woman didn't even crack a smile, make any welcoming comment and basically gave us one cocktail menu and immediately asked "what can I get you?". Nothing worse than not being fully seated and settled in and someone's harassing you for your order, and still not a smile to be had. We got up and left and spent out $360 on dinner at Chica at Venetian. Sorry Wynn/Encore-thought you paid more attention to the quality of your staff at your high end restaurants.

This is not $$. This place is ridiculously overpriced. My husband and I went there for lunch and ordered the following: cheeseburger and fries, steak salad and two iced teas. Our bill was $80.
You are better off going to a buffet or CPK across the street at the mall.

The waitress was very accommodating and the food was quite yummy. 
I had chardonnay and for dinner had a slice of the margarita pizza and the mac n cheese poppers ( I think that is what it is called ). Not too bad. The place itself is beautiful as we sat down by a big ball of flowers in the middle of the restaurant. The down side was that I had asked the waitress to bring out one of the deserts with a candle since it was my friends birthday but when it was dessert time, the waiter who brought it out just brought it out without a candle and didn't even put it in front of the bday girl which we specifically identified. Awkwardly, the waitress realized and took it back in, put a candle on the side and laid it back down and left. It was awk but we made the best of it.

So for being in one of my favorite hotels the experience my friends and I had at this restaurant was horrendous. So lets start off with our reservations. We were a large party and had a reservation on Saturday night at 8:30 for 11 of us. They told us that if we were late or did not show up we would be incurred a charge of $50 dollars per person. We got there early and were not even seated until at least 45minutes past our reservation time.  We inquired about the wait twice, the first time we were told that they were still waiting for one of the tables to leave.  The second time they told us that they were going to relocate the current table to another table.  Once we got inside I was a little confused because the restaurant was not busy.  It wasn't even half full so I don't understand why it took so long for us to get seated.

Then, we finally get seated and the waiter takes our drink orders.  They had a moscow mule cart and about half of us ordered one.  It was delicious and we all enjoyed it.  It was also really cute and a good way for us to get our drinks right at the table.  

About fifteen minutes later we noticed that the tables around us all had warm pretzels/bread sticks.  We had to flag down a busser to inquire about it and they were the ones that brought some out to us.  That was strange, I thought the waiter was supposed to do that.

One of us ordered a soup and salad at their dinner, the salad arrived about 30 minutes after ordering.  However, it was over and hour later by the time we all got our food.  When we did get our food we received two salmon steaks that were completely raw in the center and a steak that was ordered medium well but came out raw.  The rest of the food was pretty good.  I had the fried chicken but my side dishes were cold.  I did not want to send my food back because I was so hungry and did not want to wait another hour before getting my food.  The other half of us that got hot food, really enjoyed their meal.  However, I was so hungry that I got full waiting for my food.  I hate blaming the server because he does not control the kitchen.  He was actually pretty nice and accommodating.  Meanwhile there was a table near us who arrived at least thirty minutes after us, they got their food before we did.

I think that this was the longest dinner that I have ever had.  We were so tired and over it by the time dinner was over.  Finally, we pay our bill and after we get our change/cards back we ask to speak to the manager. We were being polite and told him what happened. That was a waste of time because all that he said was, "Thanks for the feedback" and walked away.  That was completely rude and he did not care one bit.  I do not think that I will  return to this restaurant.  This is pretty high on my list for some of the worst service I've ever had.

As a vegetarian, I'm always excited to try places at the Wynn/Encore given their veggie-friendly reputation. I love dining out at restaurants that can offer both a stunning ambience and vegetarian options that branch out beyond pasta dishes (*le sigh*). 

Given that, I'm super impressed by Jardin. We came late on a Wednesday night to celebrate a birthday. Our server was incredibly friendly and attentive. He made us smile since he also surprised us with a complimentary flower pot dessert that I still have not stopped showing pictures of to my friends when they ask how the trip was. I can't believe how realistic they can make it look all while ensuring it's completely edible (and delicious, mind you). 

As for the actual dishes, we split the buffalo cauliflower (with vegan blue cheese) and I ordered the mushroom steak. I seriously want to travel back to Vegas just to enjoy this entree again. I wasn't in the mood for anything fried, so the chef slightly modified this to err more on the baked side. My boyfriend's hot pot wasn't his favorite, but he still enjoyed it overall. They also deliver complimentary pretzel bread to the table along with homemade mustard spread. I usually can't stand mustard, but appreciated this pairing. 

Coming here is a good life choice. You won't regret it as you look out onto the gardens and enjoy the larger-than-life floral centerpiece while enjoying unique cuisine.

This place was great. We made reservations and they seated us outside, per our request. We had the crab cake for an appetizer. Very good, but. A little on the small side. The wind started up and it was cold, so the waiters found us a nice place inside. The hot twisted pretzels w butter was yummy. I ordered the boneless short ribs and hubby ordered the fried chicken . Both were great. The Brussel sprouts w scallions that came with the fried chicken were out of this world!  This place states casual dinning, but I felt like it was more like relax  and enjoy your meal in casual clothes and eat like a queen and king!

A lovely spot for lunch/brunch! I'm a sucker for pretty flowers, so the decor won me over immediately, but the food doesn't disappoint. 

The smoked salmon and eggs were delicious, flavorful without being overpowering, and filling. The most memorable menu item was definitely the flower pot cake, which is almost too pretty to eat. An Instagram worthy foodie pic! The cake was moist and not too sweet. Enough for a few people to share.

Service usually is pretty good, although it can be a little slow at times, even when the restaurant isn't busy. I've found this to be true at other Wynn restaurants, but I think it's because they don't want the diners to feel rushed.

Their menu is a bit pricey, but that's to be expected on the Strip and at the Wynn.

The Margherita Pizza is outta the mind delicious! Crunchy cheesy slices that melt... Recommended by the restaurant and they were right! The latte was also nice with raw sugar stick!
Service was nice too - great view of the pool and the garden! 

Oh and watch out for the birds that might land in your table :-)

I came here last week with some business associates and while the food itself was great, the service was not. Our drinks, meal, to go dish, and check all took SEVERAL requests from several different staff members before being brought to us. Certainly not what you'd expect when spending a bit of money on a breakfast. Three requests spanned over 15 minutes for a diet soda? A side of pancakes being brought out once everyone's done eating, despite the two inquisitions previously made at the arrival of the rest of the dishes.. not acceptable, and not worth coming back. They need to do a refresher on what it means to be AT WORK, instead of standing around in groups of 3, chatting while paying customers struggle to get their full meal and drinks.

Staying at the Encore and wanting to eat "in house" I spent some time looking over the reviews of my different options.  Jardin, overall, had good reviews, though there seemed to be a common thread of inattentive and slow service by wait staff.  I would be dining alone and had nothing else to do, so if dinner took too long, it wasn't going to effect me negatively.

I was greeted at the entrance by two smiling, pleasant hostesses and could be seated immediately: on the patio or inside.  After inquiring about the temperature out on the patio, and being assured it was comfortable and there were heat lamps, I chose to sit there.  It was breezy, and cool and I didn't feel much heat from the nearest heat lamp; glad I was wearing a long-sleeved blouse!  

(The occasional waft of cigarette smoke from another patron or two seated on the patio was unpleasant, but not overwhelming.  The tables ARE close together and since I was dining alone, I could, without straining, overhear the conversations at the tables to my left and right--but had I been engaged in a conversation at my own table, those conversations probably wouldn't have even registered with me.  And being off-season, there wasn't any noise from the adjacent pool.)

As I was seated, the hostess gave me a drink menu which contained a respectable number of offerings.  (One of the couples eventually seated next to me weren't given a wine menu, the hostesses had evidently not retrieved them from the wait staff; their waiter brought them one upon request.) After asking a couple of questions of the waiter (he was knowledgeable of the cocktails) and asking for his recommendation, I settled for a spritzer (absolutely delicious) and some water (no ice, please).

I also ordered a bowl of chicken noodle soup, the kale salad, and a side of the Brussels sprouts.  Within minutes of placing my order, my soup was delivered (hot, not scalding, so it could be enjoyed right away; hearty; tender cubes of chicken with a heaping serving of noodles).  While enjoying the soup (and consequently being warmed from the inside out), the "bread basket" arrived: warm, soft, chewy, pretzel sticks with a side of horseradish whipped butter (or was it aioli)--I am NO FAN of horseradish, but this was outstanding.  There was a bit of time before my salad and Brussels sprouts were delivered, so I requested some hot water with a side of lemon; promptly delivered.  The kale salad was good, though maybe a few more croutons than I would have liked, but balanced flavors and very filling.  The Brussels sprouts were superb and served hot in a miniature cast iron skillet.

With the little room I had remaining in my stomach, I chose to have dessert: layered cheesecake with dark chocolate cake.  This was the most disappointing item I put in my mouth all evening...but it was still good.  The cheesecake was creamy and delicious, but parts of the cake layer were too gummy/springy for my liking. By now I was full to nearly bursting and left half of it on my plate.

As I was leaving the restaurant I stopped to use the restroom: small (2 stalls and only 1 sink), but very clean.

Both my waiter, Dan, and "busboy", Cris, were attentive, courteous, kind, helpful, prompt.  Their service of my table and the tables next to me was excellent and helped turn what could have been a lonely dinner into a lovely dinner!

Maybe it's more like 3.5 but, it was just OK.

The OJ is not fresh squeezed at all.. in fact, for the whole Wynn/Encore property, there was a blatant disregard to fresh OJ. I'm all for paying $8 for OJ when it's truly fresh squeezed.. but when you give me a glass of sour, watered down crap, you're shitting on my whole day!
My hubby felt the same about the coffee...both those items being the first sips of the whole day, you want it to be good and get you off to a great start. Go weak with it, you might as well throw water in my face and send me on my way. That's a bit dramatic, but we take our OJ and coffee seriously!

You look at a place like Jardin and, wow, what a stunning GORGEOUS scene.
Fresh flowers boasting throughout, mirrors everywhere. You feel you're in for an amazing dining experience. 
But, no.. no.. the experience IS the visual scene around you because the food is meh. The service was weird too..I couldn't keep track who was my waiter or busperson and I felt our busguy was more helpful than our waiter and our waiter was hella snooty. 

I had the lobster benedict with hashbrowns (which is more of an herby potato brick) and my hubs has the pancakes. I liked the benedict OK, I had to ask for more hollandaise sauce, as they literally put a thimble-full on the eggs. I had a bite of the pancakes and they were just doughy, no fancy flavors..I didn't even taste vanilla or any other flavor enhancements that could be used to make pancakes amazing!

So there ya have it. If you're just wanting to grab a drink or take in a beautiful setting. Jardin is the place to do it! If you want an amazing breakfast within the property, try the Terrace Point Cafe.

We are at the Wynn for a conference and were looking for on-property dining. We had a lovely meal at Jardin. The décor is very white - walls, chairs, tables, a little jarring. Our server was attentive, but not overly so, very professional. I had an arugula salad with ricotta and fennel with grilled shrimp, light and tasty. Hubby had salmon that was cooked just right, served with Brussels sprouts. It's the Wynn/Encore so it's pricey, but the quality and overall experience was excellent.

Jardin was a great place for lunch. I ordered my New York steak medium rare with some asparagus and mashed potatoes. It was very decent. The steak was a perfect medium rare. Since I love asparagus so much, I also ordered the bacon wrapped asparagus. It was delightful.

Jardin's decor is very nice on the inside, and they also have an outdoor patio. If you get there at the right time, it isn't too hot to enjoy the outdoors. 

Service was decent for such a restaurant. They did a great job!

I was surprised the reviews weren't better as we had a lovely meal here.  I wasn't super hungry so I settled on the roasted tomato soup (YUM) and the mac' cheese bites (SUPER YUM).  Cocktails were delicious and service was great.  

If you don't want to eat here, at least pop in to the bar for a cocktail because the design of the bottles up and across the ceiling is pretty neat.

Date & Time:  Monday July 25, 2016 @ 11am
Location:  Wynn 
Dining Companion:  Mommy
Scene:  Couples & Families; Ladies in Nude Summer Dresses w/ Matching Chanel Bags
Decor:  Bright & Cheery.  Opulent Floral Displayin The Center of Dining Room,  Pristine White Tables & Dining Al Fresco
Service:  Professional
Imbibe:  Fresh Green Juice
Devour:  Fresh Fruit & Ricotta Pancakes
Total:  $45

If you're looking to experience the mot fabulous gluten free/dairy free brunch...this place will not disappoint. Fortunate to have the most knowledgeable, understanding server, Rick, who clearly had white glove service experience. Absolutely in heaven with my experience and meal - not an easy place to arrive considering food restrictions. A chef, kitchen and staff that makes this possible has my full recommendation!

Let's talk tomato soup for a second, can we? In Las Vegas? At a hotel restaurant? 

Yes and yes! Jardin had the second best I've ever had and maybe the best croutons ever. And don't get me stated on the pretzel bread sticks with mustard butter. Yeah, mustard BUTTER!!! Epic. The soup was so textured and perfect. Not so much cream that you lost the tomato or vise versa. With just a bite and a dash of mancheco on top. Very very good. 

The steak salad was just as good (the burgers that went by also looked unreal) and came with an actual steak! Not little strips, but a hunk of burning love.. hey it's Vegas after all. Then the salad part that was so well thought out and over by itself. 

Service was so good and quick. Professional would be the word. And the setting was gorgeous as is most of the Wynn properties! 

Lastly, a Bloody Mary cart went by with a smiling bartender. That I will save for next time! Looked great.

Food is pretty good there, but somehow high-priced for this quality. But we're at the Wynn - Encore, so you would like to think it worth it. Unfortunately the service is very poor. We had a reservation that they decided to cancel without giving us any reason, so we had to wait for more than 30 minutes meanwhile the restaurant was pretty empty. Then the waitress forgot our drinks; we finally got them when the appetizers came to the table. Same thing with the wine, they brought us the bottle but we had to ask 3 times for somebody to open it... I guess the poor waitress had too many tables to take care of, but the ballet of supervisors, managers, whatever around was even more upsetting as none of them would help her or care about the guests. Keep your money and run out of here!

Jardin is a nice, casual lux place to enjoy a meal. First off, they got carpet on the bottom of their tables y'all. Apparently that's code for classy. 

I recently went for an industry mixer at Jardin where they were serving a prefixe menu and the food was so damn good!!! Just wish I hadn't ate so much before going to XS! 

Margherita Pizza- it's no NY pizza but definitely a nice starter 

Kale salad-  I could've ate 12 plates of this. Who the heck likes Kale anyway?

Steak kabobs- steak was tender and the veggies were nicely marinated 

Penne pasta- my favorite dish of the night. It had corn, eggplant, and it was bomb. This was what slowed me down at the nightclub for sure. 

It was nicely paired with their Moscow mule. Odd cause it was served in a glass. 

I would love to go back for lunch because the view overlooks the pool and it's so serene and pretty. Can't go wrong at Wynn/encore when dining.

I've probably walked by here a million times coming and going to XS, yet never really give Jardin a second look into dining.

This visit brought me here for my friend's bachelorette dinner. Although I wasn't entirely hungry, I did order chicken noodle soup. It was the perfect remedy for a slight hangover. I did have a taste of the roasted chicken and wow was that moist. The chicken breast was so juicy and tender, it didn't even taste like I was eating white meat. And the mini pretzel loafs were delicious. Comes fresh and warm.
Oh, and the dessert! We shared the chocolate cake that looks like a pot of flowers. Everything was edible. We felt so guilty breaking it apart. It was so pretty!

Beautiful huge floral decor in the center. Felt almost whimsical inside. The staffs are super attentive and friendly. We never had to wave them down to refill our water. I forgot our servers name, but she was great and patient handling 14 girls orders. When the food was brought to the table, they knew who ordered what. I appreciate the little details.

Jardin was highly recommended by the concierge at Mandarin Oriental due to Steve Wynn (owner of Encore and Wynn Hotels in Las Vegas) making sure there are vegan options in his restaurants.  Ambiance in Jardin is lovely, light, and bright with white decor and indoor and outdoor seating available.  The room was uncomfortably warm due to the door to the outside seating being located within 30 feet of where we were sitting.  The highlight for me was the vegan entree of Mushroom Dashi, a beautiful bowl of baked tofu in broth with  baby bokchoy, mushrooms, and rice noodles.    It was delicious and creative.  Unfortunately, the non-vegan entrees left a lot to be desired.  The pork chop was a large portion and a good cut, but it lacked flavor and the sauce was uninspiring.  The salmon was dry and inedible.  The waiter removed it from the table without even asking why the diner left almost the entire fish on the plate.  The most disappointing aspect of the dinner was the service.  From waiter to the waiter's assistants, the staff cultivated a stiff and pretentious demeanor that was off putting.  With all the delicious restaurant options available in Las Vegas, we would not try Jardin again.

This place was okay. I am a little bit disappointed. It's expensive and for what you get, it doesn't garner the prices. I got the steak salad. The steak quality was sub par at best. The arugula had some rotted leaves. You would think for a $24 salad they would have better quality control. My husband ordered the chicken salad. It was good but for $18 you don't get fries. I wouldn't come back.

We were going to an event at Encore, so decided to eat dinner there since it would be convenient.  I wasn't familiar with Jardin, but we gave it a shot and were very happy with our choice.  

We asked to be seated by the window and it was interested seeing all of the people by the pool.  Good people watching.  The décor of the restaurant is beautiful as well.  

Our waiter was very attentive and gave recommendations that we enjoyed.  My boyfriend would normally not order the chicken, but he did this time and it was great.  I also loved by lobster pasta.  Big chunks of lobster!
This restaurant had the best ambience! It is great for dinner and/or just grabbing drinks. I wish there were more places like this in Southern California.
The food was excellent. Perfect birthday dinner with the perfect potted flowerpot for dessert.
We had Jardin Tuesday night about 14 of us. Almost everyone hated the food along with a list of other issues, luckily we have dogs to feed leftovers. Highly not recommend!

Hey Michelle the hostess...
As a hostess, it would be appropriate to address the person that gets to your hostess stand first, not the "celebrity hairstylist from the hotel" who is 20 ft behind me and who is probably going to get his meal comp'd anyway. I am sure my money spends just as well as his. You never know who you will be snubbing when you overlook people....like presidents of large pharmaceutical companies. Just sayin. If you are going to be in the service industry, then serve, regardless of the clientele. If you want to serve the hairstylist, maybe he needs a nanny.    #fail

I wanted to try Jardin for dinner, but ended up checking it out for brunch. It is located in the Wynn, with inside and outside dining available. It has a bright French look to it. The restaurant is filled with beautiful flower arrangements that add a lot of charm to the ambiance. The menu featured items such as Nutella French toast, Kale scrambles and a variety of eggs Benedict dishes. I really loved that they had smoothies and fresh juices on the menu. I ordered the Strawberry vanilla and the Antioxidant smoothie. I loved the Strawberry vanilla, but didn't care for the Antioxidant smoothie as much. I sat outside which had a garden feel that overlooked the pool. I ordered the Lobster Benedict. The presentation was beautiful, and the meal was decent. It came with a perfectly formed hash brown  right in the middle. I wouldn't say I was blown away by the meal, but I would definitely visit the restaurant again. The service was friendly, the restaurant was beautiful, and the menu was diverse. Perhaps I will try it for dinner next time around.

We recently had lunch at Jardin. So happy they have vegan options! I had the vegan pizza and it was heaven.  The waiter was perfect and the atmosphere opulent. I was beyond pleased and the prices were reasonable. Cannot wait to go back.

My wife and I came here after a long walk on the Strip. First of all, the ambience is so relaxed and and colorful with the surrounding elegant flowers and pool setting outside. We had the following:

Grandma's Chicken Meatballs $14

Chopped Kale Salad $14

Sea Scallop Cioppino $29

Hot Pot $20

Biegnets with Raspberry Sauce $10

The chicken meatballs were absolutely divine! They were probably the best chicken meatballs or maybe meatballs in general i've ever tasted. They were tender but still had a good texture and the tomato sauce and ricotta cheese helped the dish add more flavors. The kale salad was good. Next time though i would ask for the dressing on the side bc it was dressed pretty well. I liked the apple slices in it which made it refreshing. My cioppino tasted good but I thought it was too small of a portion for $29 and the scallops were of the small variety. My wife's hot pot consisted of kurobota pork, kimchee fried rice, and a fried egg. I thought it was good but not worth $20. The dessert was fantastic! The beignets were surprisingly light and airy with the acidic raspberry sauce to balance it. The service was great. Our waiter described to us in detail about the menu. FYI, the menu does include an allergen guide which shows how customer focused this resto is. I give it 4/5 stars bc the ambience and service were great and the food tasted pretty good. The chicken meatballs and beignets were 10/10 on execution and taste.
Best crab cake in Vegas. Underrated restaurant...Better than many of the higher rated spots around town. Located in the Wynn Encore casino hotel.

Beautiful, bright setting.

Great menu and service.

I've been a few times, and plan on returning.

Bad service at the bar 5/17/16 shortly after noon from the older gentlemen bartender. Stood there for 5 mins before I was greeted by another younger bartender who showed up from the back room who then said the older gentleman would help me. And even then, the older gentleman ignored me and just shuffled things around in the counter.  Left as I was in a hit of a hurry.
Service is outstanding. Ambience is wonderful. Hard to get outdoors seating during busy hours. Food is small in potion but very well made. Frenchie.

My wife and I ate here for breakfast two days in a row (November 2016).  I had the fillet and eggs both times.  My wife got a omelet one day and the French toast the second day.  My fillet was pretty good. Not the best I ever had but still pretty good.    My wife's French toast and bowl of berries were excellent.  The staff was friendly.

Fun little spot in the connection hallway between Wynn and Encore.  This Garden was beautiful.  Flowers everywhere, beautiful art and just an all around great place to sit an enjoy Brunch.

Some of their menu options were very creative like my Chicken & "Waffles" which was a French toast with a hole cut in the middle and egg fried inside with some buttermilk fried chicken placed on top and maple syrup.  Some options were not very creative like the fried chicken sandwich which was literally that.  Fried chicken breast in between two pieces of bread with some slaw.  Not sure what my friends expected but they were definitely jealous when they saw my dish.  We had some sweet potato fries with the chicken sandwiches and they were waffle cut and very delicious.  Service was friendly and attentive.

Honestly I'd give this place 5 stars but I feel the menu was slightly lack luster (maybe needs a bit more options) and also the cost for what you get seemed a bit out of whack.  This place is very pricey.

I know I rated this 4 stars, but I'd probably not choose to come here again.

My friends and I happened to stumble upon Jardin and decided to try it for brunch. We are so glad that we did! Walking through the Wynn is a treat itself and then Jardin is beautiful as well. 

I wish I knew his name but the nicest guy made drinks table side. Mimosas and Bloody Mary's that you could customize. They were all fantastic! The Caesar was my favorite. The coffee was great too.

Our brunch was amazing! We shared avocado toast, Eggs Benedict, and Maine Lobster Benedict. I highly recommend Jardin!

This place is so good, we ate here 3 times in a 3 day stay at the Encore!  We went for breakfast smoothies.  We had a great lobster roll for lunch the following day.  Then we loved it so much we had to try their interpretation of chicken and waffles before we went home.  I love eating at restaurants that make you feel like they appreciate your business.  Las Vegas is a city where this should truly be the norm and not the exception, but Jardin goes the extra mile to make sure they ask you the questions you forget to think of to make your experience a great one.  I'm sure we will visit this restaurant at least once any time we stay at the Wynn or Encore in the future.  With so many dining options in Vegas, its comforting to know a restaurant that never disappoints!

Came here for a friends bachelorette.  I ordered the Salmon with a Ceasar Salad and they were both good. We shared the chocolate cake that looks like a pot of flowers. Everything was edible. It was too pretty to break it apart!

There was a huge floral decor in the center to make the place feel more upscale. The staffs were attentive and friendly. Our server was very patient with handling our large party of 12 and when the food was brought to the table, they knew who ordered what.  I appreciate that the manager  came by our table make sure we were having a great experience at the restaurant.

LOBSTER EGGS BENEDICT. If you're staying at Encore or Wynn, would definitely recommend rolling out of bed and walking over for brunch. The restaurant itself is elegantly decorated with a garden theme, as its name would suggest. There's also patio seating but given it was December, we opted to eat inside. The lobster eggs benedict was $24 but worth the price. It came with ample lobster that was well-seasoned and cooked. I also really appreciated the sauteed spinach and classic hash brown to round out the dish. Lastly to note, there's a roving cocktail cart in case you're up for a boozy brunch!

I can't believe it. My experience here was so delightful I stopped caring who was president. That's pretty damn good. Joe the Chef is such a good guy I told my wife to leave me for him because I mean come one, what a nice guy. I'd suggest this to anyone who wants a great tasty meal with a creative experience and love in every bite. If you lost any money gambling at least you'll feel like a winner here.

Tip- I heard they have an awesome desert menu so ask about that

I had mixed luck with the food here: the Shrimp Capellini was "adequate" - it left something to be desired, and I would not order it again. However, the Adult Grilled Cheese & Hearty Vegetable Soup were surprisingly good.

Similarly, I had mixed luck with the service here: the staff generally took pretty good care of us, but one of the servers was a bit clumsy and spilled some soup while attempting to deliver it to us (yes, I know the job is not easy, but it does bear mentioning).

The seats are comfortable, and you get a nice view in the heated patio. Overall, I would come back here again, but I would definitely order something else. The Barbecue Short Rib Sandwich looks pretty good.

Ate at this place two days in a row due to the simple and good breakfast. The restaurant is beautiful and their hashbrowns are amazing. I ordered the 3 eggs over medium with bacon and hashbrowns. Amazing service and everyone in our group was pleased. Would definitely go back for more. 

FYI: Be aware that you cannot sit inside the restaurant with a tank top (its more formal).

The decor is beautiful the food is delicious and the price is just right ( relative to the surrounding Venus).  This is not a loud pumping music-high energy  95 db joint like STK steak house but a classy calm establish where you can carry on a nice conversation while enjoying your superbly prepared meal.  It was a perfect setting for me as my voice needed a break from a 4 day club hoping marathon which completely obliterated my voice box with the help of the dry air.   I've been here a few times and its ever changing menus have never disappointed me.  I posted some pictures and every dish we ordered was delicious.

Nice decor, has a classy/casual feel. The hostess(I forgot her name but wow 10/10) and waiters were extremely nice. I had the delicious turkey burger w/ roasted tomato aioli and avacado. Had to constantly ask for refills but that's pretty normal for my drinking habits.

Ehhhhh. What can i say. We got there fairly early by Vegas standard- around 9/930. Place had opened tables both inside and out. So did we get seated - no, we had to wait for 5-10 min. Whyyyyyy? Not sure. We ordered - coffee is exceptionally strong- be aware. Took forever to get our meals. Service was slow - again, unsure why since there was not many people there. It took 25-30 min once we ordered. I had the chicken and waffles. Their take on it is - it's actually not a waffle but more of a French toast with an egg cooked in the middle of it. It was good but nothing fantastic- esp when we waited so long. Had to ask for coffee refill. As we left my friend asked me if it was a repeat. I quickly answered -  no way. So overall service that included a long wait for our meal, overall value/ price, & food quality/taste - totaled 2 stars. That was my experience.

My favorite breakfast spot anytime we are at the Wynn!! Delicious bloody Mary's, eggs Benedict and pancakes!  You can't go wrong eating here.  Have tried dinner here as well and it didn't disappoint either. There's usually a wait to sit outside, and making a reservation is suggested!
The chicken meatballs are killer!  Great for a light bite before dinner.

Came back to Vegas about a month ago with my hubs. We always stay at Wynn as it is our favorite hotel in Vegas. After gambling for hours, like it was no one's business, we decided it was time for dinner. 

From the outside, Jardin is lovely, no doubt. Every time I've walked by in the past, I always commented on how I wanted to try the place out. On this particular night, Saturday, it wasn't busy at all. We were seated immediately, so that was nice. It pretty much went down hill from there. 

Drinks: Took forever. The alcohol is one thing, but the water and soda didn't come out until the food came out. My double vodka came first but took as long as it would if the restaurant was actually busy. (Many empty tables.) Server said the bar was backed up. I looked over and there was 1 person sitting at the bar. Yah, really out of control. The server had to bring out a cart full of alcohol for the table next to us. Super dramatic style as if the bartender was swamped af. I laughed, literally. No idea what that was about.

Food: Like I mentioned... took forever. Restaurant 85% empty. I actually ate part of the bread basket which I never do. So long... so hungry.  I ordered the salmon. It came with white rice. The rice was hard af. Unedible. Comparable to the rice at the bottom of a cooker that u don't scoop because you know it is blown. I can't believe the chef even plated it. You can tell, visually without even trying it, that it wasn't good. I told the server. He seemed nervous and unsure of himself most of the night. Service should be stellar especially if a restaurant is most empty. They comped my one double vodka which is cool, but I was hungry. :( Salmon was decent, but I have made and had better. I'd expect a whole lot more considering the price is high for what it is. My hubs ordered the ravioli. It was seriously enough for maybe a child. I believe this is why their bread basket has big soft pretzels in it. They try to fill you up with that because they know their proportions are off with taste quality low. I felt bad for him. The plate looked really sad and was over $30, I believe. I understand we could have ordered appetizers and would have if it wasn't for the fact the food was so meh. Even if the plate barely had any food, at least make it amazzzinngggg. Then the price would somewhat make sense. 

Would we ever dine here again? No. Just not worth it. Sinatra, at the Encore, is sooooo much better. Also, this restaurant looks to be more popular day time. Wayyy busier. Tables are filled. (Can imagine bartender would be out of his mind.) They also have an outdoor dining area which overlooks the pool. I guess I would come back just to sit in the patio and bask in the ambiance? I guess that deserves 1 star.

Food was average. We came after breakfast time and were dying for breakfast and our server went back and talked to the chef and was able to make us breakfast. Very happy with the service but the food was nothing special.

I enjoyed everything about this place. The customer service was excellent, the decor is beautiful and the food was delicious. You are greeted immediately by pleasant, well-dressed and polished staff. They confirm your name by cross referencing it with your hotel stay and address you by it during your entire experience.

The seating is lovely, bright colors, sparkling place settings and a fresh brilliantly colored single flower. I choose to sit inside however there is outdoor seating that highlights the beautiful water. My seat gave me an upfront view of the outdoors, beautiful flowers, luxurious seating and the colorful plant life. Gazing out the window was calming and relaxing. As I was seated the host neatly placed my napkin on my lap. I was immediately greeted by another staff member, again by my name who filled my water glass and took my drink order. Once I received my coffee the staff member offered to go over any questions I had about the menu and offer suggestions. I choose coffee to start and the Jardin Burger with fries.

Everything arrived quickly and hot. Before I received my order I was given complementary warm twisted soft butter pretzels with a spicy mustard. Delicious!. My burger was not only delicious it was a beautiful presentation on a wooden cutting board along with lettuce tomatoes and a colorful hot pepper. The fries were so-so nothing to speak about they were eight dollars a little pricey but OK what the heck I'm on vacation. 

In all it was a great value, the lunch items are not extremely pricing. I enjoyed the quiet time I spent glaring out into the courtyard. Every restaurant or customer service person at the Encore offers superior customer service! I enjoyed everything about this dining experience if you ever have the opportunity I highly recommend dining at Jardin.

Eating healthy in an "Alice in wonderland" setting.
- Avocado/hummus/tomato toast: 3.5 stars - beautifully presented, but avocado on top of hummus was a bit odd and two mushy textures together is no bueno 
- Lobsta benedict: 4.5 stars - perfectly poached egg atop of meaty lobsta. That hash brown cake was super crispy and delish! 
- Shrimp quinoa salad: 4 stars - salad was fresh and the quinoa didn't overwhelm. Shrimp cooked well.
- Fresh juice: 5 stars - so delicious and all fresh squeezed!
- Vegetable soup: 3 stars - flavorful, but all the veggies were diced the same size, which I found odd

Overall, beautiful setting and my stummy left happy and feeling happy (not overstuffed)

I would have expected more from an Encore restaurant.  While considering the pricing wasn't bad for Las Vegas, the food just wasn't that good. We did the fixed menu option.  They start you with a literal tea cup of cauliflower soup - it was basic.  Next We had the chicken meatballs and crab cakes as an app, both were actually quite good!  We both thought it was going to be a good meal... until the main dishes came.  I had surf and turf and my husband had the roasted chicken.  I don't think they used salt on anything.  My steak was disappointingly bad - over cooked and no flavor.  Shrimp was cooked fine but bland and they topped it with a type of pesto that didn't work with with of the proteins and didn't even taste good.  I actually took it off and pushed it to the side of my plate.  The broccolini was only slightly over steamed. 

My husbands chicken was served over a bed of smashed fingerling potatoes with a hatch chili sauce and side of green beans. The chicken was cooked well, but again lacked flavor.  I pretty sure they don't use any type of salt or pepper when cooking.  They shouldn't even try to call the sauce any type of chili, it's a plain red sauce.  Never would I describe it as any type of chili, more like a tomato sauce.  The beans were just good ol' steamed beans.  

They redeemed themselves with desert.  We had the maple pudding and apple crostata, both were excellent.  Wish I would have had more room to eat them.  

The other factor contributing to the three stars is that the waitress went missing for a while. We actually thought she was on break.  My beverage  sat empty for about 15 minutes.  

In nutshell, I wouldn't go back.  There's too many good restaurants in Vegas to bother with Jardin.

Food is okay, service isn't so great. I ordered a 5 course meal and left still hungry.  In addition, my bill was $105 total and still hungry.  Waitress forgot about me so after waiting nearly an hour to pay, I had to walk my money up to the kitchen door to finish paying/transaction.  Waffle House service at a premium price.

Vegan review:

One word: yes. 
As a vegan, I thought it would be hard to find food in Vegas. Turns out every Wynn restaurant has a vegan/vegetarian menu which explains why I was at the Wynn almost every day. 

Anyways, I had the veggie pizza in the "socializing" part of the menu (fancy way of saying "appetizer" I guess), and my god it was good. The vegan ricotta was very light and fluffy. It didn't really taste like cheese but who am I to say? I haven't had cheese for like 8 years. Toppings were generous and they all paired together nicely. I finished about ¾ of it and took the rest back to the hotel to eat later. If you're vegan, I highly recommend the pizza! Even my brother (who is a strict carnivore) enjoyed it!

So I'm going to start this review by saying the cake in the picture is worth 5 stars but that being said I gave Jardin a 3 based on the food being just fine. It was reasonably priced for Las Vegas with an upscale environment but to be honest the food came out very slowly and wasn't super impressive. I had a good experience and would go back for the cake but maybe not for dinner. Also, the cake was split between 4 people and was not finished. It's huge.

Good food but really small
Portions. My kale salad was good. Other people at my table got the meatballs and fried chicken as well as their soup. Everyone enjoyed their meals

In some ways, it seems like a poolside version of the now closed Society Cafe, which was a favorite of mine. I think this Jardin just replaced it, actually. Some of the menu items are the same and a lot of the staff also transferred over. The service is just as good and so is the food. Jessie is a sweetheart, so I was glad to see her again. The Cubano Sandwich was very good and the temperature on the patio was perfect. I'm sure I'll eat here again.

First time visit for Christmas dinner. The restaurant is great as you would expect from a Wynn property. The staff was friendly and attentive. Service was great. Our waiter and sommelier were terrific. We ordered from the chef's set Christmas menu which consisted of Bacon Wrapped Scallops with Kale Caesar Salad, Prime Rib with Garlic Mashed Potatoes and Custard Covered Brownie. We also tried the additional Wine Flights that accompanied each course. Dinner and service was excellent and we recommend patronizing this restaurant.

Hands down the best restaurant in Las Vegas. The service is phenomenal. They start your meal off with a salted pretzel & a house made butter with mustard seeds. We ordered the herb crusted salmon & for dessert we did the coconut tapioca. This place is fantastic for anniversaries, a birthday dinner or any other kind of celebration. Beautiful atmosphere, great service & delicious food. What more can one ask for?!

If you want a less than stellar meal, a poolside hotel restaurant offers pretty good odds.  Jardin strives to beat those odds but, like most of the players in the casino, it falls short.  

First, the good.  The space is quite lovely, with a tasteful floral motif.  We sat on the patio, and the heaters kept us comfy, even on a cool January day in Vegas.  The patio was even far enough from the pool to keep you from getting drenched by overly enthusiastic kids doing cannonballs.  But that's where the really good part ends.

My wife and I both ordered Eggs Benedict, and we agreed that we have had much better.  The eggs were perfectly cooked, but the hollandaise was skimpy and the English muffins were dry and a bit hard.  The hash browns were definitely second rate - sort of a brick of (riced?) potatoes that elevated creativity over flavor.  And by "creativity," I mean I have never seen anything quite like it.  Also, while $20 is not totally outrageous for Eggs Benedict (especially at the Wynn/Encore), for that price couldn't they have put a little slice of orange or sprig of parsley on the plate to dress it up a bit?  It all seemed kind of sparse.  Our friends both ordered omelets.  I didn't see them projectile spitting their meal across the patio, but they weren't exactly raving about the dish either.
