And both of them left their "hash browns" untouched.  

Since this was to be my only meal for the day, I also ordered a bowl of the roasted tomato soup (my attempt to convert breakfast into brunch), which was just fine.  Good tomato flavor, and a touch of tasty garnish.

Our server was very pleasant, when she was visible.  Which was not often.  It took much too long from seating to taking our order, and from clearing the table to bringing the check.  Fortunately, our friends are exceptional conversationalists.  But as it turns out, the fact that they were staying at the Wynn was the only reason to eat at Jardin.

No, I didn't try the buttermilk chicken sandwich, or some of the other dishes that get good reviews here.  But if you want a better Eggs Benedict, go off-Strip to Hash House A-Go-Go, or Black Bear Diner, or really just about anywhere.

*Service great
*Complimentary Soft Pretzels with Deli Mustard Butter. 5 stars
*Crab Cake, best ever. Lightly breaded, lots of crab. 5 stars
*Lobster Cappellini. Whole lobster tail and pieces in the capellini. Sauce was incredible. 5 stars
*Ribeye. Cooked and seasoned beautifully. 5 stars
*Lobster Mac N Cheese. Fantastic, creamy. 5 stars
*Cheesecake. Almost perfect. Could have more blackberry compote. 5 stars
*Coconut Tapioca. Pretty good. Needs more coconut. 4 stars

DISCLAIMER: If you're planning a bachelorette, the Wynn sets up awesome packages for you and your girlfriends. Jardin was one of the restaurant options that we chose so we dined here on a pre-fixe menu.

The restaurant is decorated with gorgeous fresh flowers (one of the things that the Wynn is known for) and the ambiance is intimate. There wasn't anything really to rave about the food except for yellow tartare, avocado salad and the pretzel sticks (all appetizers). I also liked the flower pot chocolate dessert that actually looked like a flower pot! We enjoyed the Moscow Mule cart a little bit too much, and they happily provided us to go cups for the excess cocktails we weren't able to finish at the table.

The service was friendly and attentive during our experience here. They were accommodating to our requests (to go cups, to go boxes, more napkins, etc.) and they didn't have any issues with how we wanted to share our entrees family style.

I would give give Jardin another chance and try their regular menu the next time I stay at the Wynn.

When looking at The Wynn's restaurant offerings, Jardin looked SO up my alley. From their al fresco patio, beautiful decor usage of fresh flowers and healthy food options I was immediately sold.

Unfortunately my experience did not live up to the expectation. Unlike other Wynn restaurants the service was erratic -- we had to wait almost fifteen minutes to be greeted by a server and our orders came out incorrectly and with odd timing. A point for enthusiasm, however.

I got the Lobster Benedict which sounded impressive but in reality was not. The dish came out mostly cold and inconsistently cooked and the hash browns were hard as a rock. Due to myself being starving, I ate it anyways but I decided not to return during my week stay at the Wynn. There are many better options within walking distance!

The food here is decent, but really not much more special than any other breakfast I've had, especially for the price. Even though I'm staying at the Encore, I'd rather find another place to eat next time around. Service was not to the level I would expect, especially given the price point and type of restaurant it is. It is a really nice, relaxing poolside place to eat, however.

5 of us came for brunch on Sunday our last day in Vegas for a few months. We discovered that the society cafe had closed and jardin was now the place for breakfast at the encore. 

Jardin is located where botero was located. Very nice place that looks out on the pool. Beautiful. We had brunch. We really like some items in the society menu like the monkey bras,but nothing seems to have survived on to the jardin menu which is a bummer.

Jardin's food was pretty good. 

Bennits with raspberry sauce good but not as good as the monkey bread from the old society cafe. 
Chicken and waffles was good. 
Buttermilk chicken sandwich very good. 
Bowl of berries expensive but good. 
Coffee excellent
Adult cheese sandwich and soup was great. 
Side of bacon wonderful. 

The service was ok, not great 4/5.  The food was 4/5. Overall 4/5.
I am giving 4 stars for the food and the decor. The service sucks. Never was asked how was our food. Some employees should learn etiquette. I will try one more time but lunch.

This was one of the most beautifully decorated restaurants I have seen in a while. Gorgeous giant centerpiece of flowers in the center of the restaurant. The Wynn always has beautiful flower displays. And the waitress was very attentive and sweet. We came for my birthday lunch mostly for the flower pot cake. 
The food in all was good, nothing spectacular or anything to come back for but because of the cake, and service it was still a great experience. 
We started off with a margarita pizza, it was good but soggy. 
Then my friend had a salad and I had the salmon plate, again both good but nothing out of this world. 
The flower pot cake is gorgeous, it's a chocolate cake with a little cherry filling I believe. Everything is edible including the flowers and white chocolate birthday card they give you with it if it is your birthday.

This review is for Brunch only.
I've been to Jardin 4 times now and hoping for the improvement in every visit. Sure this is fancy restaurant in Encore Las Vegas, which is 5 star hotel, and the interior ambiance is beautiful. However, their quality of food does not live up to the price and the ambiance.
Reception staffs seems to be soulless in my every visit. Perhaps, they ruin my appetite, but the food is just so bad.... Service is so so.
Just go have a coffee and take lots of pictures of inside... don't expect more than a pretty selfie here....

We are always looking for a new breakfast spot to try, being residents here in Awesome Las Vegas!  We decided to try Jardin out and were pleasantly surprised. My wife just loves this place and we have already been there twice over the past two weekends! 

Each time I went we made reservations. The staff is very professional and polite. The center atrium is just so relaxing to look at. The food was incredible! I had the Nutella Hazelnut banana French Toast, which not only had great presentation but was delicious, as well! My 11 year old son had the lox and bagel,  which he found to be very tasty and my wife had the lobster benedict which she thought was outstanding. I was able to try the Cubano, which I thought was just ok. I ordered the Orange Lavender Mule - incredible... My wife tried it and it is now her favorite style of Mule out there on the strip.

Our second trip, I had the Grilled Cheese with tomato soup -Hands down one of the best grilled cheese I've ever had. The tomato soup tasted like a slightly rich marinara sauce was outstanding. Dipping the grilled chees into it - decadent. My son had the organic Salmon which he crushed and was extremely happy with. My wife had the Caesar salad with chicken which was really delicious!

We doo look forward to coming here again whether we have guest in town or not. It is a wonderful restaurant with great food, service and scenery. Highly recommend this place!

I wanted a casual dining experience while at Encore or Wynn and was debating between Jardin and Tableau. But once I saw photos of the Maine Lobster Benedict, I knew I had to go to Jardin. 

It's located in the beginning of the Encore Esplanade, right across from Hermes. It's a beautiful restaurant with tons of colorful flowers. If you sit outside, you overlook the pool area. 

I don't like ending conversations on a negative note so I'm not doing that with this review. The food was marvelous and I'll get into that soon. But the service was very lacking which was surprising to me for a luxury resort hotel. I had had wonderful service so far during my stay that I was disheartened to experience less than great service from Jardin. I was told afterward from my husband that he had made a special request TWICE (from the hostess who sat us down and to the maitre'd himself) for our anniversary. Unfortunately, that request was never fulfilled and even when he had approached them afterward, they did not make any offer of amends. 

We had three different servers. One had been moved indoors and so we had a second server. Then it got too cold outside and once we were moved inside, we had our third server. Of the three, our second server, Megan, was the most attentive. We were not checked on often by any of the other two which was a sad shame. 

But on a better note, our lunch was fabulous. I ordered the avocado toast as an appetizer and it seems pricey at $16 but it comes with three triangular toasts that are heaped on with fresh avocado, black garlic humus, pomegranate seeds, lettuce and grape tomatoes. It was delicious. 

We both ordered the Maine Lobster Benedict and it was the best Benedict I've ever had. $24 but very much worth it in my opinion. Two English muffins with large pieces of lobster on each and an excellently poached egg on top of each. In the middle was a rectangular hash brown that was a great compliment to the dish. It was very crispy and buttery. I loved this dish and highly recommend it if you're able to have lobster and don't mind the higher price. 

I also had the Orange Lavender Mule which was delicious! Loved it so much, Megan gave me the recipe from the bar.  It was so refreshing and delightful. I also had an English breakfast with milk. They serve Forte teas on the Wynn property which is nice. 

Overall, the food we had was marvelous. Maybe we just had sheer bad luck with regards to the service during this visit and hopefully it'll improve. If you want Maine Lobster for breakfast though, come here.

I went to Jardin today for my anniversary lunch. Ive been told any place at Wynn is THE place to go in Vegas for vegan options. Honestly, the food was great. My husband and I were having a nice time. And then, there were 2 pigeons under our table as there are IN EVERY SINGLE OUTDOOR VENUE in Vegas, we gave them a small pc of our pizza crust because we love animals (hence the Vegan thing) our Waitress told us off, told us not to encourage that behaviour..... Is the Wynn not a vegan (animal) friendly venue?! In my entire life, I have never been told to not feed a bird!!! Not only were we embarrassed by your 20 year old waitress, but disgusted that your staff would treat us that way when paying that much per plate, while sitting in an outdoor (vegan friendly) venue.

Liked Botero,  where Jardin now is and liked Society Cafe, which Jardin has replaced,  but really liked Jardin. 

This is a perfect all around upper scale casual, yet almost fine dining establishment. Service was superb, menu was varied and well priced and the new lighter decor was lovely. 

Will gladly return when we get back to the Encore,  which is fairly frequently, since it's our favorite hotel in town.
My family were staying at the Encore. Very good food and service was excellent went for breakfast. Had the Kale Scramble it was very tasty. I will eat here again.

I came here in March for my bachelorette brunch and the place is beautiful. I ordered the Benedict with a side of sausage. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the mimosas were delicious! Overall I had a great brunch experience here & would return. The service was also great, our server was very attentive and brought a cart to our table to serve mimosas in front of you.

Had lunch here today. The lady who greeted and seated us has no personality at all..no smile...no introduction or even a good morning..have a good day. We got there at 1130 handed a bfast menu and said its limited since its already lunch time. Then why did she hand out the bfast menu? Asked for the lunch menu..already got our drinks bfor she came nlback w menu . Ordered our burger fries and tuna appetizer as soon as we got the menu...didnt get our food till 1210....more than 30min. The table next to us who came later than us already got their food and had started their meal. I think they forgot our order since our server brought us some pretzels to start with...35 min later...and no apologies or anything that our food is taking a while....a burger we ordered mind you...then we even got a scoop of ice cream afterwards..hmmm...would not recommend this place at all...there was hardly anyone thwre and our order took that long. They should have comped our entire meal....nice ambiance but poor service

I had two breakfasts here, not dinner, but the breakfasts were outstanding!  The juice was so fresh, and one day in got the pancakes and the next day eggs+.  both were outstanding with nice extras you don't see many places.  It was pricey like all of Las Vegas, but when i get food of this quality and caliber, it's worth it!  give it a shot.

We love have breakfast here...
Eyes can eat nice view too
The breakfast steaks are amazing

My husband and I really enjoyed the food, ambiance, and service here.  Has a great atmosphere and food was done right.  I recommend the buffalo cauliflower, the ceasar salad, as well as the fish fry.  We would definitely come back here next time we are at Wynn/Encore.

My husband and I stayed at the Wynn for a business conference, our daughter and her significant other joined us in Vegas while there. Wanted to treat them to a really nice family dinner. While the Wynn is one of the most
Beautiful places we've stayed- they need to look into staff training in this particular restaurant! The food is fantastic! Can't say enough about the good menu choices and execution- but the service is terrible! Huge downside!  Our server was friendly, but
She was really bad at timing and attention. Ordered drinks and salad first, after a really long wait! We were done with our salads before our drinks ever came! She didn't ever come to check whether we wanted another throughout dinner, which we did. Again- the food is great! And the chefs are doing a great job! But in a resort of this price level we expected better service.  The steaks were very good- but don't expect your water glass to be refilled, or
To  be able to order anything else from the bar!

So let me start off by saying that out host was polite and go us seated right away. Mind you it was 10pm on a saturday night so the restaurants only had 3 other tables filled. Before we ordered he was very attentive asking everyone in our table whether they had allergies or not. The problems comes after we order, I understand we had a party of about 10 people so the service would be delayed a bit however we did not expect to be waiting over 1hour and a half for our food. Now the food seemed to be reasonably priced (I ordered a filet minon medium rare $49). So not only did we wait what seemed an eternity but the food was 
mediocre to say the least and that might even be shooting a tad too high. My filet mignon wasn't evenly cooked and even worse more than half of it was rare! When I brought it up to the hostess attention he said they can only try to cook what ever portion was left. Any and every place I have been they will serrve a new portion. The jardin burger my GF ordered was overcooked  and dry.  This was a birthday dinner for a good friend of mine that pretty much ruined our night.

Eww. Don't get the beef short rib taco. The beef was so dry and hard that it tasted like pork. They give you very little guacamole with the entree. Flavorless entree. Terrible service. Our waitress looked like it pained her to take our order and that we were bothering her if we needed something. Unfriendly and inattentive. Probably because they include the gratuity for a large party. Not only that, but they'll tax you on top of the top they pre add. One star for the Mac and cheese appetizer and bread, and another star for the beautiful decor.

Lovely spot for brunch at Encore hotel.  Ambiance is great, exactly what you want before heading to the pool.  On Saturday, they had a Bloody Mary & Mimosa cart rolling around the restaurant, and it was fantastic!! Made to order, and the best Bloody Mary I've ever had! 
Service was hit or miss.  On Saturday, we sat inside.  It took a while to get coffee refilled and the food took a while to come out.  On Sunday, we sat outside, and the waiter was fast and fantastic.
The kitchen is where Jardin could use some improvement. I would skip anything with poached eggs unless you enjoy raw egg whites.  On Saturday, I ordered the Eggs Benedict. Hardly any of the white was cooked. I'm not sure how they even got the egg to maintain it's shape on the plate.  On Sunday, I ordered the lobster Benedict.  I noted upfront the issue from the day before, and still one of the eggs again came out with raw whites! I'm not asking them to master rocket science, just to cook the whites of an egg...!

Nice place for breakfast in Encore, but not as good as Tableau on the Wynn side. The choices were rather basic but well prepared. The bagel and lox were good except the tomatoes were sliced cherry tomatoes which were hard to keep on the bagel. The eggs and bacon were fine but the meal was expensive.

I just walked up to this restaurant and 3 extremely rude females ignored me when I asked them two questions.  They were so rude that I walked away and will not ever be eating or spending money at ghis establishment. Word of advise to this company...people want to spend money were employees are friendly.

Ate here on Friday night, started feeling sick about an hour later and am still sick 4 days later.  I had the salmon kale salad and honestly think I got ecoli poisoning from it.  Going to GI tomorrow if diarrhea does not let up.  Ruined my trip to Vegas - what a waste!!!!!!  

Also everything took forever, including just getting the bill.

I was super excited to finally try this place and i am happy to say it did not disappoint. The food was delicious and service was great. I loved the pretzel bread they brought us out before the entrees. One of my favorite things were their mac&cheese balls, ugh the dipping sauce was so good. Then to finish off we had the edible flower pot. I thought it was going to probably be dry since the outer layer was a little hard to cut into but boy was I wrong. The inside was a super rich and moist chocolate cake with chocolate mouse. The outer layer ended up being super good too as it was just a chocolate mold. I loved the whole look of this place and I am seriously super excited to go back and try different things.
Tasting menu is awesome. Steak is soft, tender, juicy and chef works hard and do the best. Amazing garden salads.

Fantastic ambience.  Just what you are looking for in Vegas.  The food was better than good but not spectacular.

The back part of the restaurant where you can eat, you can also smoke.  But not cigars! only cigarettes, from what I was told.  

The service was a major let down.  

It was packed from the moment we got there until the moment we left.

I am going to try a few more places before coming back here but if i find myself here again, i won't be disappointed.
Beautiful venue, excellent service, and delicious food!

i was staying at encore, had lunch at jardin, our waiter lori took great care of us. we had the adult grilled cheese and the chicken meatballs. both we excellent. although i have only been to jardin once i feel like it's so much better then society was. atmosphere, service and food.

The service was impeccable. From start to finish. 
My husband's dish, the corned beef St Patty's special was good - smaller portion but doable.  The Caesar Salad was simple deliciously dressed.  Pretzel sticks also soft and yummy.

The ATROCITY though??? LOBSTER CAPELLINI $31.
Not worth it at all. And resulting in my would be 4 stars down to 2 stars. 

By far the worst pasta I have ever had at a restaurant of this level. The lobster portion was good and prepared decently, however the hot heat and Pernod sauce was way heavy and made the noodles overdone - very mushy. 

This is the point where I am starving hence ordering the pasta dish and made no say to take it back. 
And mostly because all the other points throughout dinner were serviced nicely.  
I'd also forgo the tuna stack... to much fillers less tuna.

In line with the shoddy spectacle that is Vegas, this place looks great but doesn't have the necessary sophistication in taste to justify the triple digit check for brunch for two. 

The classic eggs Benedict was made right, but nothing to be proud of, especially for the given price. The potatoes lacked flavor, and the hollandaise sauce felt plain and frothy. 

The Challah bread French toast was nice, but again, nothing great. 

We had the blood/ruby orange mimosas, and for $16 each, we were just disappointed -- it's not just the price, the taste is just not worth it!
Just came here for the dessert for the chocolate flower pot cake not bad for $20. It's something different & unique

Horrible. Where do I start? I dutifully let the hostess know when I made my reservation that I would be needing the vegan menu. When I came and she was whisking me to my table, she pointed at a tray of desserts and said "You don't want to know about the desserts, do you?" Um, I guess not. It was several minutes before someone cane to take my drink order. Apparently, my waiter Roger was busy so this fella was going to fill in for a sec. Ok. I ordered the Dandelion cocktail and some water. After about 20 minutes, same fella came back and said "Roger is really backed up so I'll take your order." Mkay. I ordered the Buffalo cauliflower as an appetizer and the "red curry braised tempeh" for my entree. The cauliflower was really good. Then I sat there for an interminablr amount of time with an empty water glass, a crappy cocktail, and no breadsticks and watched a guy spend 30 minutes setting a table for 6 like he was Mr Carson and the Queen was coming to dinner. Did I mention the tables around me had bread? Then some guy with a ridiculous cart of copper cups asked me if I wanted a Moscow mule. No, but I'd like some water. At somepoint in this mess, my tempeh arrived and it was horrible.  When the person I assume was roger dropped the dessert menu on my table, I was Visibly ticked off. A manager of some kind came around to make nice since I was fuming. His excuse was that Mr Wynn was going to coming in for dinner. He comped my tempeh and I stormed out 37 dollars poorer. I hope for their sake Mr Wynn did not show up to that poor excuse for a restaurant.

Hella expensive, but it is Vegas and I'm 99% sure that everything is made fresh (I base that on how long the food took and how it tasted).

I ordered the vegan French toast and while it was delicious, I regretted it immediately because it was SO sweet. I know, it is French toast, it's sweet. It was very delicious but a bit too early for me. If you like sweets in the morning, you'd love it!

Came here after the pool party starving & we were craving burgers, chicken strips with fries. So the friendly concierge guy referred us to Jardin and we ordered from the bartender who was also very friendly and approachable. He told us that the burgers weren't on the menu but they could gladly make it for us. 

For 3 burgers/fries & 1 order of chicken strips w/ fries it came out to $60. They were so delicious too. Def will be back. 

They also have the most beautiful flower arrangements.

Came here for lunch with a friend. We split the adult grilled cheese sandwich with Gueyre cheese and tomato soup and the chicken sandwich with coleslaw. We added on the old Bay seasoning chips as well. All items are fabulous!! They tasted wonderful with great flavors. I would highly recommend dining here as the prices also were not very expensive. 5 stars!
Terrible seating and wait service. Seems like a training ground for new Vegas wait staff. Food was decent and beautiful atmosphere but I would stay away.

Just another nice restaurants to in the Wynn. Seriously, each restaurant at the Wynn has very similar fare for a very similar price, at least when it comes to lunch, and never does it disappoint. Each meal will run from $15-$25 on average and is very filling. Service is always on point and most places have outdoor seating available, perfect for a spring day. 

I had the chicken sandwich with a side of sweet potato waffle fries. The chicken sandwich was exceptionally cooked, perfectly paired with some creamy slaw. The waffle fries were good but not great. I wish the sandwich came with a side instead of having to order the fries a la cartel but it is what it is. I highly recommend the sandwich if you come to Jardin. The salad, especially with added salmon, also looked very good from what I saw at tables around me. 

Overall I liked my meal here and would recommend it for atmosphere alone if you get an outdoor seating area. My one huge complaint is the reservation process. I first tried OpenTable and it said they were booked from 10am-2pm. I then called Wynn reservations and same thing. As I showed up at noon, I found that the place was only about a third full. I just don't get how there were no reservations available if it was two thirds open at the restaurant. Jardin needs to fix this issue as I want people to give it a try and not get nervous about having a wait or not getting a table at all.

We loved our two breakfasts at Jardin, especially because the service was superior in every way. For instance, we thought the creamer for our coffee was a little on the turning side, and mentioned it. We instantly had new cups, new coffee, new creamer and the old carried away.

The ambience is lovely, and the view of the gardens (Jardin) makes breakfast even lovlier.

We enjoyed our veggie frittata and chicken sausage and eggs entrees were very good. I especially enjoyed the frittata with sundried tomatoes, goat cheese, broccolini, manchego and parmesan. 

I think my husband was a tad disappointed in the chickeen sausage. He expected something that was less like grocery-store sausage. But the taste was good.

The coffee was unlimited and very good also.

Expect to spend $70 for breakfast though. The loveliness costs!

I can honestly say I have no qualms about my experience at Jardin. In fact, my experience was more than above average. It was superb!

Pros:
-Outdoor seating option; despite being near one of the pools, you don't feel distracted by it and it doesn't reduce the restaurant to a "poolside snack shop."
-No wait, at least on 8/9/16
-Nice ambiance and interesting decor (dark grey water glasses, nice, subtle green linens paired with white and black trimmed chinaware)
-Attentive service
-Despite having a daunting menu (in a good way), the dishes don't take too long to come out
-They offer organic salmon
-Dishes had beautiful flavoring

I ordered the healthy option kale salad and added organic salmon to it. The salmon was very good quality and cooked perfectly. No knife required, broke into perfect slices upon sinking my fork into it. The kale salad was equally delicious and had a very flavorful dressing mixed within it. The dish was very fresh and hit the spot!

My partner ordered the chicken, which was very tender and juicy.

I absolutely would visit this restaurant again. The only thing I would recommend they do is offer a few more options for each meat. For example, a few chicken dishes, a few salmon dishes, etc.

We ate here in April for lunch.  I prefer the dinner menu to the lunch menu for the appetizer selection.  I ordered a burger with a side of fries.  The burger was great and worth every cent.  The fries fell a little short for $10.  Jardin is still one of my favorite restaurants at the Wynn/Encore and I definitely plan to go back.
Great food but horrible waitress. Very slow service. Waited 15 minutes just for water!

We were surprised to see that this new restaurant had just opened, and decided to try it.  That was the best decision we made.  Even though they had only been open a few days, the service was top notch and the food was spectacular.  Arianna was our server, and she treated us with so much joy and passion, and any request was met with a fantastic smile.  I ordered the Pork Chop and the oven baked Mac & Cheese with ham, both were cooked to perfection.  I highly recommend trying this place.  We for sure will be back.

Reviewing brunch here. Service is super slow, but the taste/quality of the food is actually pretty good, particularly for the strip! 

Great for dietary restrictions (vegetarians/vegans). I couldn't eat dairy due to a stomach problem that day, so they quickly made adjustments like replacing the hash browns for roasted potatoes, and butter for vegan butter. 

The food:
- Chicken omelette with egg whites + avocado: very healthy and not overly oily, great for recovering from a long night. Hefty portion of avocado. Came with perfectly toasty/crispy roasted potatoes that weren't drenched in oil, and your choice of sliced toast. 

TLDR: if you've got a minute and want quality brunch, would definitely recommend this joint.

Visually the restaurant looked great. The menu even looked good with what it had to offer. So we decided to go there for my birthday and then see the show Le Reve (best show in town by the way). So we get seated in what we thought was a private table. Well every 30 seconds there was a buser getting into storage by our table.....Then the employees belly aching about the set up and complaining to each other......We ordered a pizza and 2 lobster rolls......The lobster was terrible and the bread it was on was just as bad......The only saving grace of the night was Joseph the manager. He really took charge and made it up to me and made me feel like it was my birthday.......He was great!!!!!! Sorry to say with so many places to go in town we will never go back there!!!!!!! Maggianos is right across the street and its a great place!!!

Great breakfast spot. The lobster eggs Benedict was great, and the crab cakes. Their tea and juice selections were also amazing. Service could be better but the food definitely makes up for it, and the ambiance.

This is more of a formal restaurant. Service was great. The have good vegetarian & vegan options that are clearly marked, & the staff are familiar with this. I had a seasonal mocktail, Mushroom Agnolotti (arugula, Pecornino cheese, roasted mushroom, Marsala glaze), & the vegan tapioca desert. This was more than enough food. This restaurant is at the Encore hotel (next to Wynn).

Delicious tomato soup! Beautiful restaurant and decor. Situated between the Wynn and the Encore. 

Service is very slow

Looks great from the outside, but quite underwhelming once you begin to dine. We ordered the turkey burger, salami and mushroom pizza, tomato soup and butterscotch pudding.
None of these dishes were anything special. Total bill was $100. We won't be going back as the cheap food quality and high price tag made for an overall disappointing experience.

During a staycation at Encore I was able to eat at Jardin for breakfast. We were promptly seated by the hostess & asked about the vegan menu since we mostly eat plant based. There were so many options that I was amazed despite having heard that Wynn restaurants are famous for having plant based options. Businesses often boast that they have one & then you're aced with an option of tomato pasta (boring & I can make that myself!) but Wynn has an extensive menu. We ordered the tofu scramble breakfast with sourdough bread (they even have a few vegan bread options to choose from) & the banana french toast meal with black coffees. We also had a good waitress who was very professional, checked in on us every now & again, & answered our questions about the menu. 

The food was wonderful. The tofu scramble meal was delicious & not overly flavorful but just right. It wasn't overbearing in tumeric like a lot of tofu scrambles are.. in fact I don't know that the chef even used tumeric. If so it wasn't obvious which I liked. Perfect for the first meal of the day because it wasn't as heavy as it looked. The meal is also loaded with breakfast potatoes so for my potato addict self it was a great combination. The banana french toast was our favorite because it's hard to find a vegan french toast that is made well & tastes like.. well actual french toast! Topped with berries it was heavenly. 

The restaurant is fairly casual but still elegant. I liked that people here were engaged in quiet conversation. Sometimes on the Strip even at breakfast it can get super loud & obnoxious so being at the end of the Strip has its benefits. The decor at breakfast was bright with real flowers on every table & floral decor all around. I look forward to coming back here in the future for a brunch date to try different plant based options!

What an absolutely gorgeous restaurant. The decor inside is fabulous and it's nestled in the garden and pool area of the Encore. My family and I came in for dinner one evening and we were all impressed with the quality of this restaurant.

They offer these warm delicious pretzel bread sticks and regular crunchy sticks to start off with. For dinner, I had the salmon and it was probably the best salmon I ever had. Perfectly cooked and seasoned. 

I decided to try a dessert and went for the chocolate flower pot. It was HUGE!!! It actually looked like a flower pot and it was rich and chocolaty without being overly sweet. It was way too much for one person to eat. 

I would definitely recommend coming here if you are looking for a fabulous dinner with beautiful views and excellent service.

This was the first time at the Wynn where I didn't go to their outstanding, heavenly buffet. I def should have gone though because Jardin unfortunately did not hit the spot. First of all, it is one of the more 'casual' restaurants. Every restaurant in the Wynn and Encore is pretty classy, so be prepared for the higher prices that go along with the amazing decor and service.

The food here was creative, but the flavors were off-balance. The fried chicken and waffle was overly breaded and under-seasoned. I wanted to ask for cholula, but stopped myself since it was a $20 dish! The eggs benedict was on par with any other brunch restaurant. Their coffee tasted burned. They forgot our fries and our server had way too many tables. To be fair, it was super busy with long lines at the front all morning.

Sadly, I still haven't found a go-to breakfast/brunch spot in Las Vegas. Bouchon was also underwhelming, so maybe I should just stick to the Peppermill? That place is consistently good breakfast at all hours. Next time i'll pass on Jardin and prob do the Wynn buffet.

Unfortunately, we had a very unenjoyable dinner here last night.  We were cold, so we sat on the patio.  It was crowded, but fine and inside the restaurant was almost empty.  We ordered a bowl of soup, flatbread, arugula salad and chicken meatballs.  We asked our waiter to bring everything out at once so we could share.  We then waited over 30 minutes for our soup and salad to arrive.  Ouch.  Every table around us was being served while we watched and wondered where our remaining items were (meatballs and flatbread).  And we waited. And we waited. Without apology, our last two items showed up after the salad and soup were long gone--at least 30 min later.  By then it was over the acceptable wait time and the patio chairs became uncomfortable and the other patron's smoke started to annoy us.  We had intended to go in for a few appetizers and got stuck in service hell.   In hindsight, I should've spoken with the manager but we were in a hurry to get out of there.  Enough was enough.   Definitely the slowest, most irritating service we've had in Vegas in a long time. 
(Two stars because the meatballs and flatbread eventually were delicious.)

The chocolate flower pot cake is so good, one of the best I've tried. About the dishes, nothing really to love. We tried the carpaccio, crab cake, kale salad, the branzino, raviolis, and the lobster spaghetti.  Salad was my favorite of all this. I know...sad. Drinks aren't the greatest either, we tried the lavender mule and the orange blueberry mule. Service is ok. Atmosphere is good.

My mum Got the half roasted chicken with Brussels sprouts and green beans. AMaZiNg!! I got a kale salad with medium well done steak and this was good too. Customer service was great!!! From being greeted at the door to getting dinner. Enjoyed ourselves here!!  Prices are 30$ + which is understandable as it's very classy. Enjoyed myself here!! My server WADE was amazing!!

Food was delicious... Server was great. The time to get served took a bit longer however we didn't mind since we had great company! They did forget the ice tea until the end of our dining... But that was the only mistake! The restaurant was beautiful and the dessert was absolutely amazing!!!!!!!

My boyfriend and I are locals and made plans last minute to do a staycation for the weekend. We called the Wynn and was told that Jardin was the place that could accommodate our reservation time. The waiter was polite and efficient. Everything we ordered came out fast (almost too fast). The food was average at best. I would not recommend this restaurant to a friend

Mohammed, our food runner was great! Very attentive and friendly. I was also very grateful for the fact that there were vegan options on the menu. Unfortunately, the rest of our experience was quite underwhelming. Our server was double sat by the hostess, so he took about 20 minutes to take our order and we probably waited another 20 minutes to get our drinks (which were delivered by a shaky, unapologetic manager). The only reason I know the server was double sat is because that's the first thing he told us when he came to take our order; he was visibly upset and made us all feel very unwelcome. The experience only got better when Mohammed delivered our food; that was literally the only time we felt welcome and accommodated. My friends were visiting from out of town and I was so excited to bring them here for brunch; instead I left disappointed and embarrassed for having brought them to such an overrated & lackluster establishment. Living in this city, we are spoiled with so many dining options and you expect to get the best of the best at Wynn or Encore but I've honestly had better service at Applebee's!

Beautiful new addition in Encore Hotel. We were here in December 2015 and this place was just under construction. They have outside patio right next to the pool in a gorgeous setting with trees and flowers surrounding the whole area. Came here for Mother's Day lunch. Very good food and nicely presented, could not expect anything less of Encore and Wynn hotels. Love coming here and highly recommend to try all of their restaurants at least once !
Service was a little slow and could have been a little friendlier. Reason for 4 stars.

Went for a birthday dinner with 8 people.  The service was good.  Sangria was excellent.  The item everyone raved about was the green pizza.  The beet salad was on the tiny side but delicious.  The real miss was the flower pot cake.  Way too rich and chocolatey.  It's a beautiful setting though.

What a great way to start off our day!  Our server was absolutely incredible and recommended so many delicious plates. He was also was very conscious of any allergy concerns we may have. You have try the avocado toast it may have been the best I've ever had. The setting is beautiful and overlooks the pool. You can eat indoors or out. Love this place.

Saw an advertisement for Jardin so I decided to give it a try. I'm a big fan of the Wynn/Encore casinos but I've never eaten there. I usually make reservations but I was too lazy I just walked up and was seated within 10mins. The decore is open and airy with beautiful flowers. It was a toss up between the chicken sandwich and chicken and waffles/French toast. I decided on the French Toast and a Cajun Bloody Mary. The Bloody Mary was very good and the food was good also. I would recommend Jardin for Breakfast/ Brunch.

I knew I wanted to dine at Jardin for 2 reasons: the Impossible burger and the flower pot cake.  I was happy to get both! We started with Tito's and soda and a Van Rose.  Both delicious.

My husband got the prix fixed menu while I chose to do a mishmash of options for my meal. I started with the "beef' croquettes, which are made of the Impossible meat.  Basically, it looks and tastes like beef but is a pure vegetarian protein.  My husband tasted it and said that if he wasn't told it wasn't beef he wouldn't have known that it was veggie.  It's now more available at Umami and The Counter.

I got the chicken entree, while my husband had the crab cake and the filet. He liked his crab cake and the filet. I also enjoyed my meal but wanted to save room for dessert.  My husband received a butterscotch pot de creme and he enjoyed it. But I was waiting for my flowerpot cake.  It did not disappoint! It literally looks like a flowerpot and for $18, you got a large cake.  It is so good.  And when you make the first break into that pot, and the cake comes oozing out, it's so worth it.  The cake was rich and had a wonderful layer of raspberry jam filling.  It was rich, moist and enough to have for random bites over the next few days (when kept on ice).

The is not a cheap meal but with the beautiful garden and floral ambiance, neat looking colorful bar and great meal choices, I recommend coming here.  And get that cake to share with your table mates. So delicious.

Jardin, I am soooo sad that you have less than perfect reviews.... Hopefully my review will take you out of the orange zone and into the red zone....


Our breakfast experience at Jardin was nothing but perfect. We asked to be seated on the patio. It was a bit chilly so we asked for the heaters to be turned on. The employees were very attentive and nice.

The Coffee: It is from Fonte coffee roaster in Seattle. Steve Wynn made a special trip up there to choose this coffee to be served at Jardin so it is super special and ofcourse one of the kind.....Just do yourself a favor and order it.

The Nutella french toast was amazing..... It had walnut on the top.... I don't like any kind of nuts in my food so for next time I will order it w/o them.

I don't usually say this, but if you find yourself within 100 miles radius of Wynn hotel, get to it.... Just to try that heavenly coffee.... Yup it is that Good!

I am usually not a big breakfast person but I LOVE enjoying brunch on weekends. I had an amazing experience at Jardin this past weekend. Rick was our server, he was so kind, attentive, and made sure our dining experience was perfect. I highly recommend their vanilla latte, and omelette. I would definitely dine here next time I am in Vegas.

The Service was excellent. I ordered chicken and my wife ordered salmon. They give you soft pretzels which are amazing , the pizza is awesome. I really didn't like the chicken but that's my fault, I also ordered a flower pot cake for my wife's birthday and she loved it.
Nice place. Love the flower pot dessert. Came back with my mom and daughter. Nice and quiet, away from the riff raff of the strip.

Best Maine Lobster Benedict!!! I've been here a few times already and staff was amazing! Came here for brunch with one of my girl friends and we sat outside, weather was just right, not too hot/cold. Plus we got to enjoy views of the Encore pool. Jardin means "garden" in French and this restaurant is suppose to make you feel like you just stepped in one. Lots of fresh, floral arrangements in the restaurant and a huge one right in the middle of it. We both got the Orange Lavendar moscow mule and lobster benedicts. The moscow mule was strong, but still blends well with the orange, which I liked! Keep it coming! And the lobster benedicts was just how a perfect lobster should taste like with just the right amount of buttery goodness! The staff is so accommodating here. On another occasion, I came and just missed breakfast service! The waiter told me he'll check for me because there still was some breakfast items in the kitchen. Sure enough, I still got to have my bacon, eggs, and potatoes! This place is a Wynner!

Amazing! Great ambiance, customer service and food. I had the lobster Benedict and it was outstanding. It had the right amount of everything, they didn't hold back on the lobster. Sauce was great, eggs were cooked just right and home fries were fried perfectly. I totally recommend it!

REVIEW FOR VEGANS

Went here with a group of 10 omnivores 

I had a salad, bruschetta that was billed as an entree & 2 drinks.

Service was gracious, but slooooooooow

Food was tasty. But that bruschetta is NOT an entree-- especially when you see how dang big the MEAT options are

Menu has clearly marked the vegan & vegan possible options

Decor is lovely

Cocktail was AMAZING 

Bill for all 10 of us was $710

If you ever get to Vegas you need to try this place.
They have the most delicious breakfast with nice view and amazing decoration.
The only i gave them 4star for not organizing waiting time and brought me wrong food.

Beautiful restaurant, great service, and delicious food!  We loved the fabulous warm pretzel bread with mustard butter, and enjoyed all the entrees suggested by our server. The Lobster capellini tasted heavenly and included a full lobster tail and lots of chunks. The pork chop was cooked just right, with a wonderful sauce!  Definitely a great find at a reasonable price.
Really, really poor service. Expensive food that is not worth the wait or the price. Not reflective at all of a 5 star resort.

Forgettable food but unmatched ambiance.  The Buffalo cauliflower was pretty good.  The service timing was exceptionally poor. They did not bring the app before the meal but then accidentally brought an extra entree we had to return.  Then we went through the meal with no attention and wanted a round of drinks. We ordered but the drinks did not come for 10+ minutes and arrived with the check.

I don't understand the low stars, every time we come here for brunch ,the food is so fresh and full of flavor . They have lots of healthy fresh pressed juices and great cocktails . The service is amazing and very professional . Not to mention how lit up it is with fresh flowers and all the windows to enjoy the view of the pool . Yes , it busy so just make sure you make a reservation for brunch or breakfast .

Absolutely beautiful location for a smallish (40) business dinner. We were seated overlooking the pool and the weather was so perfect we didn't realize we were outside at first. The food was excellent and the dessert was stunning and tasted wonderful. The chocolate dessert was a beautiful potted plant with edible flowers. It went so fast I couldn't get a picture.

Brilliant! I went looking for a vegan breakfast and this venue didn't disappoint. Servers were attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly. I had the tofu scramble and it was excellent, perfectly crisp potatoes, nice scramble, and several options for bread. Venue outside is peaceful and relaxing for an early morning breakfast

As I was walking to the Wynn from Encore, I saw a sign for endless spaghetti with garlic bread and cesear salad so we stopped at the Jardin. 

Food: I should have read the fine print a/o asked questions. It was bottomless spaghetti, garlic bread and cesear salad but it was served with a marinara sauce rather than bolognese so admittedly, I was disappointed. The pasta was cooked al dente and my unrefined palate again, was unhappy. Jardin totally delivered on the meal, I just expected cheap spaghetti bolognese but was served a much nicer meal. We also ordered the Thai chicken wings which were very tasty and the green vegan pizza which was surprisingly good for vegan food. 

Service: excellent! Our server was attentive and friendly. Dishes were delivered at reasonable times and our drinks were always filled. No crazy wait for a table when there a lot of empty tables. The hostess was so kind to ask us our input for a table and moved us closer to the pool. My experience here was so much better than Andrea's!

Price: reasonable given the excellent service and food. It's not cheap but definitely worth it!

Location: it's located in the walkway between Encore and Wynn but closer to the E. Jardin is also located next to the pools so you could sit outside and enjoy the lovely atmosphere of greenery and water. We did and it was beautiful. 

Overall, I'd go back to Jardin and recommend it!

Live in Las Vegas and met out of town guests here for dinner. Being graduates of the Culinary Institute of America and having owned a 4 star restaurant for 16 years, we can be picky. Best meal we've had in a long time. Between the 4 of us, we had buttermilk fried chicken, roasted half chicken, and the pork chop. Everything was perfectly prepared and delicious. Very happy we decided to eat here.

Food was very good. They didn't want to honor our reservations because of the Super Bowl; however that seemed pretty silly since there were so many empty tables. Staff didn't leave a welcoming impression. Fixed menu worked for our group (~$55/ea) Apple dessert was simple & delicious large enough to share. So aside from awkward time with staff, we had an enjoyable time watching the game, talking and enjoying the food.

I love the Wynn and Encore properties and almost everything in them. Jardin is no exception. I eat here almost every Vegas trip. I just love the bright colors, the attention to detail, and the patio that overlooks the pool. Perfect spot for a relaxing lunch. The food and drinks are expensive, as everything in Vegas is, but good enough to be worth it. I love almost all their cocktails but my favorites are: cucumber martini and ginger poppy martini. As far as the food, again I like almost everything, but my favorites are the kale salad and fried chicken burger. Definitely ask for the bread basket. It comes with soft pretzel sticks and a honey mustard butter. So good!

I'll be back on my next trip!

Had a great time today. Service wasn't great. Took Katie 10 minutes to greet us. However the food and ambiance was fantastic. The best tomato soup I've ever had. Service with grilled cheese. They had gluten free bread which I have to eat but it was phenomenal dipped in the soup. The restaurant is stunning just like everything Steve Wynn touches. Really had a great time. If the service was more attentive, 5 stars for sure but we never received the bread, coffee, refills we asked for.
One word: Excellent! A lot of vegetarian choices, fresh juices and amazing staff! Love this place!

Very nice place.  But. But but. The service was horrible today. 

Slow with the drinks. 20 minutes to get a glass of wine. 
20 minutes to get a salad. 
Empty water glasses. 

Maybe it was our server but not a good day. 

Not on my list to try again.

We've stayed at the Encore several times and have loved everything about this resort including the restaurants, so I was expecting another wonderful meal at Jardin on our first visit since they opened. The restaurant is beautiful, surrounded with Windows and adorned with fresh colorful flowers. Unfortunately, the tables are very close to each other and it was annoying to hear the conversations of people next to us, literally 18 inches away. As for the food, I expected something similar to Terrace Pointe, typical Vegas cafe, nothing exotic, but reliable fresh delicious food. I was disappointed. First of all, it's a very limited menu. We came here around 2 on a Friday after checking in and before hitting the Encore pool. Half of the menu was breakfast, with only a few salad and sandwich choices. I went with the Caesar salad with grilled chicken. The salad came soaked in dressing, it was very soggy and iced cold as if it was sitting in a fridge before they doused it with dressing. Also, for an extra $7 I expected grilled chicken, this was cubed pieced of semi frozen chicken, similar to what you'd find in a bag at the supermarket. I understand that Caesar is made with anchovies but the fishy taste was overpowering. I ended up sending it back and the waiter apologized and offered me something else. I was turned off and no longer hungry so I passed. My husband ordered the fried chicken sandwich which he liked, I tasted it and it was pretty good. I  recommend walking over to Terrace Pointe at the Wynn if you're looking for a cafe, skip Jardin.

Great ambiance and menu. Since it's at a Wynn property they had an incredible vegan menu, and will even bring out a vegan bread option for the table if you ask (the pretzel bread has an egg wash). The servers are amazingly knowledgeable as well -if you have any food allergies/aversions just let them know and they can point out what on the menu to avoid/modify.

Had dinner here & it was spectacular. I ordered Octopus & lobster tail. We were seated by the window, with a poolside view, and our waiter, Dan, was very attentive and professional. 
I asked for fresh juice, and Dan brought me a delicious fresh carrot/pineapple juice. 

My lobster tail was very good, and the rib eye steak was great as well. 
We ordered dessert and the NY cheesecake was great. 
For two, dinner was almost $300, but it was worth it. Wynn is a very quiet and classy hotel. I will definitely come back.

Ordered a lobster eggs Benedict and the egg wasn't even poached... It was more boiled than poached... The bloody Mary's here are below average and they don't have mimosas, or actually anything alcoholic that isn't a Bloody Mary. What brunch place doesn't have mimosas? Tiny Tabasco bottles are a plus

Very pretty decor but I expect nothing less from The Wynn properties. A few friends & I dined here for no particular reason other than to try something new. The food was okay and the dessert very cute. The overall theme and decor is nice. The service was slow and I we had to repeat ourselves a few times on different items. We had 3 servers during our stay which was odd(didn't feel a personal touch). My friends loved the drink cart as a nice touch. I would like to come back for breakfast or brunch but I'm not fond of the slow service. SMH
Delicious. Got eggs classic Benedict. Loved the hash browns. Tasty. Worth it. The pancakes we got were okay I could have lived without ordering them
The place is surprisingly underrated. 5 stars for Jardin's crab cake, brussel sprouts and maitake mushroom with butternut squash.

My fiance and I went to Jardin for a mid-afternoon bite to eat. The restaurant was pretty much empty. We ordered a BOY Burger and a bowl of chicken noodle soup. After waiting for our food for 30 minutes, we asked what was taking so long. The waitress replied that it takes 20 minutes to cook a burger (okay, then why is it not ready after 20?). We waited 40 minutes for the food to finally arrive. The soup came in parts: a few shredded pieces of dried out chicken and exactly 4 small pieces of dried pasta. The waitress then proceeded to pour broth from a teapot into the chicken to hydrate it, I guess. The presentation was unique but the taste was awful. The soup had absolutely no flavor at all! I put a lot of salt into it and it still lacked flavor. This was not even chicken broth. It tasted and looked like beef broth or the au jus that comes with a french dip sandwich(but even that would have had more flavor). I complained about the lack of taste to the waitress and she said that the manager would come over to speak us. For a restaurant that is very highly priced in a very upscale hotel with a chef's name attached, I'd expect that they could handle a bowl of chicken noodle soup. The manager said she would take the price of the soup off our bill ($10). That was fine but not the point. When our bill did arrive we were charged $36 for a burger and an ice tea. The price of the burger on the menu was $16 but on our bill it was charged as $29! When I asked about this the waitress said she would take it to the manager. She came back with a lowered bill and stated that the manager took off the ice tea. This still did not explain the $29 charge for a $16 burger. We were so frustrated with poor service and lousy food we just paid the bill. On the way out, I asked to see the menu one more time to see if there was something I missed, the young ladies at the front desk were very rude. When I questioned why the burger had an extra $13 on it they said that it was for the toppings and fries (really, cheese?!). I asked why it didn't say that on the menu. She stated the restaurant had just opened and they needed to work out some kinks on the menu. With all of the outstanding choices of places to eat at the Wynn and in Vegas in general, why would anyone want to waste their money on this place. Awful, don't waste your time, taste buds, or money!
This place is beautiful but the service & flavor of food has a little bit room to improve ...
I love this place I saw it in yelp and I decide to try it i like it alot the steak is cooked the way i want it.. Great. Few things I wasn't sure how it works.

My Wife and I came here for our date night before going to see Le Reve, dinner reservations were not necessary though we did go on a Tuesday night. They were well staffed, and not too busy maybe 4 other tables in there with us. The restaurant itself is huge! Counting the large outside seating area.
   
      SEATING/AMBIANCE:We were seated right away and noticed immediately the ambiance was incredible! We started by trying a couple of their Mule Cocktails as there was a beverage cart making them table side which was neat. The Mule's were average, nothing spectacular. Then after a time our server greeted us after having had our drink order taken and our cocktails made at the beverage cart and asked if we were ready to order which we were. We ordered the Buttermilk Chicken entree and the Beef Short Rib Ravioli along with a side of Lobster Mac & Cheese, Mashed Potatoes and a side of Vegetables.  
         THE FOOD was served promptly which is always nice! The presentation of each and every course was immaculate (which it should be for the prices and being a fine dining establishment). The food itself however was underwhelming and we were rather disappointed in the quality of flavor or lack thereof. The Lobster Mac & Cheese was really just Okay along with the almost flavorless Mashed potatoes. The vegetables didn't have much flavor and were somewhat watery. The Buttermilk Chicken was average for fried chicken, probably the best thing was the Beef Short Rib Ravioli which even then I would say was just "Good" the best thing about it was it's unique sauce with nice flavor. The portions of course were very small (even for fine dining) and expensive. Need to deliver more then beautiful presentation and ambiance, especially in Vegas were fine restaurants are a dime a dozen.
        THE SERVICE: We maybe saw our server twice and only for a moment each time once to take order and again to deliver bill all other contact was with the the Food Delivery person or Beverage cart attendant. Overall we spent $140 for dinner and didn't bother for dessert because of the underwhelming experience up until then.  The Gelato place around the corner was great though!

We came here for brunch this past Sunday and ordered the Buttermilk Pancakes and BBQ Sandwich. Food tasted mediocre and there wasn't much of a selection. The Orange Lavender Moscow Mule tasted amazing. The waiter was very nice and attentive, and the restaurant had tasteful decor with a bright and relaxing view of the gardens. Sadly, the food didn't match up to the rest of the restaurant.

A wonderful upscale dining experience. Nice atmosphere, an excellent staff, awesome food and cocktails. The roasted Portuguese octopus was a delight, and the Tuscan short ribs left me wanting more. I can't wait to return!!

One year later, we gave Jardin another shot. 

Very nice experience. Enjoyed a bottle of malbec with our steaks (N.Y. Strip and Filet Mignon) and side (mashed potatoes). Food was cooked exactly to our liking, and server, Wayne, was very friendly and helpful. Fun atmosphere too on the outdoor patio. Next time, we'll try the bacon wrapped asparagus.

For the price and the portion sizes...not worth the cost.  The ambience is great and the place was more than 3/4 empty.  I was super disappointed I could not order what I wanted.  We were not allowed to change the side items which is absurd.  I worked in restaurants of this caliper and the key we were always taught and it was stressed...the customer is always right despite what the Chef wants to do.  So I dropped 40 bucks here and did not get what I wanted.  That is just awful.  Stay clear and save your money. What I had you can get just as good at Red Hot and Blue!!!  Here is a key....make your customers feel like kings and queens because a good portion have to save up to feel like that once in a blue moon.

Impressed by the atmosphere, but not by the service.
Jardin's menu and beautiful patio initially attracted us to dine here, so we decided to try it for dinner one evening during our most recent trip.  We were seated quickly without any reservations, but after being guided to a table on the patio, the hostess left and the service issues began.  

From the beginning of service until we paid the bill, we were disappointed.  Our server largely ignored us, not being able to offer much helpful information about the menu or the wine list, making us feel like more of an imposition than an invited guest.  We had to flag her down several times throughout the meal to order appetizers, entrees & wine, and even to request our check (which took more than 15 minutes).  Other service members were not helpful or seemingly willing to help), so eventually we just gave up hope that service would recover and tried to enjoy our meal.

Thankfully, the food was delicious.  There were not many seafood entrees, but of those offered, the bouillabaisse was the best, filled with tender squid and buttery scallops, a surprisingly light and delicate dish that really challenged the idea of what a bouillabaisse should be.  The hamburger was also well-liked, definitely filling by itself or with a generous side of fries (it does not come with fries, so if you want them, be sure to order them as a side).

Overall, if you are in a hurry, Jardin is not your best bet...but if you have time to kill and really want to enjoy the beauty of the Encore/Wynn gardens, then Jardin may be your #1 pick!

Cheers!

The restaurant manager Scott went above and beyond for us. Highly recommend the pizza dessert with Nutella and ice cream, the flower decor is impeccable, vibrant colors throughput the restaurant, beautiful ambiance!
The turkey burgers were a little burnt. The short rib was whatever. The tempeh dish is horrible. Arugula salad is fantastic. They need to work on the menu selection. Beautiful restaurant though

During our most recent visit to Encore we had dinner on our first night at Jardin, and boy were we pleased...

The meal began with a bread basket of pretzel bread sticks with a peppercorn butter spread. Usually u say "ugh" when pretzel bread comes out since most places I've had it serves cold, tough bland pretzel bread which wastes precious appetite reserved for the appetizers and entrees that I am there for.  I decided to try a bit more out of curiosity for the taste of the peppercorn butter spread.  I was VERY surprised to bite into a hot soft delicious breadstick with just the right amount of salt which the peppercorn spread complemented beautifully.  I have never spent more than an passing comment about a bread service, but I felt that I needed to share my delightful surprise...

Moving along...  in our group of four people, we ordered both appetizer and main dinner courses.

Appetizers included the Roasted Tomato Soup about which the two in my party who had it raved.  My wife and I split and Caesar Salad which was very fresh and crisp, dressed perfectly with just the right amount of dressing and Grana Padano cheese. Delicious!

For our entrees my wife and I split the Short Rib Ravioli and the Bigeye Tuna Poke.

Short Rib Ravioli consisted of delicious braised short rib meat stuffed in pillows of fresh pasta to form the ravioli.  Parmesan cream sauce with port glaze to add some nice flavor perfected the dish.  If you love, like or can tolerate short ribs and enjoy a rich (but not overwhelming) cream sauce, you will LOVE this dish (hopefully) as much as I did!!!  

The Tuna Poke was very nice and fresh and balanced. My only suggestion to improve it to my taste would be to add more avocado. Something about sashimi grade Tuna diced with avocado chunks is a match made in culinary heaven.  Just my opinion though... if you don't dislike avocado you won't mind it.  

One other of our party ordered the Lobster Capellini and said that it was very good. He finished the dish and he is not one to do so unless it is something he truly enjoyed...

Service was very attentive and professional.  Not one complaint or neutral/negative comment to be found.

The decor was beautiful and featured an immense floral arrangement in the center of the restaurant which brightened up the entire space.  Just gorgeous!

I rarely find restaurants where I cannot make a single complaint but yes, Jardin was THAT good.

Let's start off with service. The service was absolutely impeccable. Our waiter made excellent recommendations, checked up on us  properly and our water glasses were never empty. I wish I had gotten our waiter's name because I would request him every time. We also did not come in with a reservation. My friend and I had missed a reservation at Tableau and wandered looking for a new place (so glad we missed Tableau because in comparison to Jardin, eating at Tableau is like eating at Denny's). We were seated promptly. We did feel slightly weird as many patrons are dressed too nicely for a "casual" restaurant but the staff did not seem to care that we were underdressed.

We got three appetizers to share since my friend and I found those most appealing. Before our food came out, we were served complementary pretzel sticks with honey mustard whip. Let me tell you, these were some of the best pretzels I've ever had. We ordered the smoked octopus, buffalo cauliflower and strip steak carpaccio. The smoked octopus was my favorite! It's served with chorizo and a garlic aioli. The octopus is so tender that it cuts with a fork. I would come back for this dish alone! Next, buffalo cauliflower is a pretty standard dish. Jardin did it so well, the cauliflower was cooked just perfectly and the breading was light and crisp. Lastly, the beef carpaccio was sliced thinner than paper! Overall the food was so fabulous that my friend and I were almost in tears (yes we cry over food lol). 

I cannot recommend Jardin enough! Food was amazing, service was amazing, decor is amazing! I can't wait to come back to try their flower pot dessert. Yuuuuum.

Freaking legit!!!!! Best eggs Benedict I've ever had. The devote is just stunning and our server Rick was so wonderful. We had the yummiest bloody Mary's with a shrimp in it. I'm coming back here every time I'm in vegas!!!

Maybe the Latinos in Chee kago get better meat but this place sucked! Waaaaayyy overpriced for a white tablecloth taqueria. Wife had the chicken and the dessert was decent but not enough to warrant another star.  A taco cart would make a killing outside of here.

Decor is beautiful, classy and elegant. Servers are awful, hostess is so snobby for a low paying job. I sincerely hope management observes the employees better because it's a waste of such a beautiful restaurant to have service of a local bar. The food was tasty and portions were worth the price, tasted excellent but again, the server was such a witch. Everything I asked was answered with the most pissy, duh idiot, type of response. It was shocking, but of course when it was time for the bill she was just the most helpful sweetest little thing. No thanks chick, your tip is based off your entire demeanor, not the last 3 minutes before I judge your tip. Which is a shame because I always tip above average and she could have had that if she would have kept her snotty responses under control. I'd come back only because I really enjoyed the environment but the servers and hostess need to be replaced ASAP.

This quiet tucked away gem in the Wynn Encore is quite beautiful and elegant.  It feels like a white garden room with all the flowers and charm for a pleasant meal.  Three of us came here for dinner and overall the experience was quite good.  Service was very attentive and professional, very well trained staff.  Our table was actually near the outdoor garden so the view was pleasant too.

The only downside was I was i advertently given an old menu and what I wanted was not available, and I really wanted it!  Oh well.  I was quickly given a new menu and the choices were far less, so I ended up with a compromise, Branzino.   The fish was well prepared with a puree of potato and some veggies, all quite good.  One dinner companion wanted a small salad and they accommodated it nicely and without any fuss.

Overall the experience was good enough and a nice choice in the Casino/Hotel and away from the crowds.  And the price wasn't that bad either.

Came here on New Year's Eve food is great but service is horrible. Plenty of seats available and yet it took them exactly 46 minutes to seat us. You would expect better service for your money. Would be 5 stars if the service was good.
The Jardin is a beautiful restaurant. All the food came out great! The dessert was my favorite part, I got the flower pot cake and it was delicious! Great Restaurant, kinda expensive, but worth it!

A very nice dinner out. It wasn't really crowded for dinner on a Saturday night, I think Jardin is more popular for breakfast/lunch/brunch but our dinner was still awesome. 

I ordered the orange and lavender mule and the pork chop. The mule was fresh and light and a nice summer cocktail. The pork chop was cooked perfectly and the glaze was sweet and smoky. The pork chop was served with a cauliflower purée and an arugula and radish salad. We also ordered the meatballs as an appetizer and a side of the Mac and cheese bites. The meatballs were tender and the bites were ooey gooey cheesy and came out super hot. Jardin also starts you with pretzel bread twists that come out of the kitchen warm served with cold honey mustard butter.

We ended our meal with the famous flower pot dessert. It's a chocolate cake with chocolate mouse and raspberry sauce, surrounded by a chocolate shell, and topped with cookie crumbs and edible flowers. It's both gorgeous and delicious. The menu says that it serves 2-3 and there were 3 of us and we couldn't finish it. Honestly, it would probably be the perfect size for 4 to share unless you have a major sweet tooth (a quarter of the cake was enough to satisfy mine). 

We will be coming back in the later summer or early fall to enjoy brunch outside because the patio looked lovely, it was just too hot to eat outside the night we went. That said, the dining room is brightly lit and gorgeous.

New restaurant between the Encore and Wynn. They just opened on Friday, December 18, 2015!

The decor is very romantic in the evening, especially with a poolside view.

The cuisine is Italian and is very good. the portions are sizes perfectly if you order aa appetizer or side to share. If your group is larger than 2 you will have room for dessert.

That staff is very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu.

The wife and I had a nice romantic dinner at a window table overlooking the pool.  We started with the complimentary pretzel.bread and ordered the Margarita flatbread (like a thin crust personal pizza).  Then we had the Oven Baked Prawns and the Short Rib Ravioli.  Great tasting and just enough so that you feel satisfied without being stuffed. No room for dessert but the wife took pictures which I have posted.

Five stars!

Desayunando al aire libre, cálido y agradable, rodeada de plantas y de fondo una alberca, , tomando un café y un jugo de antioxidantes de betabel y zanahoria. Pedimos huevos Benedict y desayuno de huevos estrellados y tocino. Me encanto el lugar y el personal amable.

I had the organic salmon and it was amazing. I've also had the jdori chicken and it's equally as delicious. We always eat at the bar and have a great experience. The dining room is lovely and so is the view. There is a Moscow Mule cart that comes around should you want one prepared table side. Dress nice when you come. Nice jeans work but hats and baggy sweats are a bad idea. So are basketball shorts.

Over priced and over rated.  The menu is extremely limited.  Burger started at 13.95 plain,  and any topping such as cheese or mushroom is $2 extra. Steak salad is very weak i.e. bland. Except for service,  everything else is below par.

Delicious food, great atmosphere and wonderful service. Nice options for vegans/vegetarians, including an incredible coconut tapioca pudding for dessert! Special shout out to our server, Alicia, who was friendly and efficient.

Great new dining spot located right next to XS nightclub. I can see this is going to turn into a wonderful prelude to a night at the club! 

I had the white bean soup, to start. This is a tomato based hearty soup. When I am trying out a new venue I like to order small bites . This allows me to enjoy the menu.

My next selection was the crispy shrimp. Oh my goodness kill me now, this is beyond delicious. Arranged in the plate in a 5 "petal point " design. Perfect 5 star in every detail. You must give this a try . 

The room has a sleek 60's modern vibe. This environment just makes you want to linger that extra moment.

Service was great. Food was delicious...  friend had the pancakes and I has the French Toast with blackberry compote yummmmmm can't wait for tomorrow morning. The country sausage was not good but the ft made up for it.

This message is directed solely to the management of this restaurant. 
Please do not change anything about this place. The food, the wait staff, the ambience, the décor all of which were top notch. My husband and I walked into the Wynn and were directed by their employees to check this place out if we wanted a delicious meal. When we walked in I was totally blown away by their overly dramatic floral arrangement in the center of their restaurant. It was so beautiful it took my breath away. We were seated at a beautiful table and our waitress did not rush us one bit or get frustrated at my indecisiveness. I ended up getting their Crispy Buttermilk Chicken Sandwich, and im so glad I did. My meal definitely did not disappoint. I especially love how they did not give me a huge portion and a big enough sandwhich that filled me up. Unfortunately, the portion size was just enough to leave satisfied but I didn't have any room for what looked like an amazing dessert. I can't really remember what my husband got but I do know we both cleaned out plates. They are a bit on the pricy side but we didn't mind as we definitely got more than what we paid for. Long story short, this place is a must visit if you are ever in the Wynn.

We stopped here for small bites and drinks after watching the Le Reve - The Dream show, which btw is amazing and I highly recommend it if you're looking for family friendly entertainment in Vegas!  The hostess set up us under the heaters in the patio which was so cozy and beautiful. Our waiter was polite and very attentive to our table.  We ordered the mac and cheese bites and the buffalo cauliflower which both were delicious. The white sangria was very delicious.  Will definitely come back to try their entrees on my next trip to Vegas.

That was great experience on Thanksgiving eve. They offered thanksgiving menu 3 course meal which we choose. First course was beet salad or squash soup we took both. Salad came with too salted Brie cheese but soup was perfect. Second course was turkey with classic cranberry sauce and mashed potatoes. Everything was melting on the tongue. Dessert was apple crostata with ice cream. Well... crostata came with too thick crust but apples and ice cream inside was really good combo. 
Interior in restaurant is really great. Everything looks modern and elegant. I definitely will be back. 
Price was moderate $55 per person. We end up paying $160 with drinks, tip and taxes.

Great restaurant! My overall experience was beyond words. I asked to be seated in a special place when I made the reservation on OpenTable and the staff obliged. They really made my birthday that much special by respecting my wishes. The service was exceptional and the food was delicious. The food portion may not seem like a lot, but it will definitely keep you full for the vast majority of your day depending on what you order. I had the pancakes and my boyfriend had the smoked salmon scramble - both dishes were delicious. I should also mention that a very nice couple order a dessert that I was going to order for myself as a birthday dessert, but the couple offered to give me theirs because they were also full from their meals. Our waiter also brought out a scoop of ice cream with a candle and edible "happy birthday" message to pair with the dessert! I was so surprised by all of the sweet gestures. Great place to be for any special occasion!

YUM! The Encore and Wynn won't let you down, regardless of how casual the dining is or how upscale. Jardin, my readers, is the perfect medium. Offering delicious cocktails and American fare, I went with the lettuce wrapped turkey burger and broccolini. Hands down best turkey patty I've ever had. Also the best twist to a Moscow Mule I've ever sipped on. The pool side ambiance is wonderful during dinner as well - just make sure you make a reservation on Open Table. This place can get pretty crazy!
The spot for good breakfast.

The decor of this restaurant is very elegant and chic.  I love the white color scheme and floral accents. came here with a big party who was very fancy so we did everything fancy.  For appetizers we had the meatballs, fried cauliflower, oysters and beef carpaccio. I loved the beef carpaccio. It was delicious and smokey with the cheese on top. I also loved the oysters. They were on the smaller side and it comes with lemon and a garlic olive oil sauce. They were fresh and delicious. 

For the entree I got the filet mignon medium rare. I also got a chance to try the ribeye, and sea bass. For the meats you had he option of adding on a side of shrimp scampi or lobster tail. My friend got the lobster but I ate most of it. The lobster with the butter sauce was very good. A little over cooked because the ends were dry and chewy. My filet was perfect. It was a perfect medium rare throughout. It was super lean but very very tender. It was juicy and flavorful. I absolutely loved it. The filet came with broccolini on the side. 

Usually the ribeye is my favorite cut of steak because of the marbling but I tried my friends ribeye and I definitely liked my filet better. It was a little chewy I felt that the cut was fatty but the fat wasn't well distributed. It was still good but the filet is better quality. 

We didn't get a chance to try dessert because we were so full but I definitely want to try their flower pot chocolate cake. Our bill was extremely hefty for the wine and food. But service was excellent and food was delicious.
