Wait!!! They need to be in business a little longer. One star because the servers were wonderful but the food was awful. 27.00 for a lobster roll which basically had 2 small pieces of lobster. Mainly 2 square pieces of bread. Cubano 
sandwich was greasy. The fries were chewy. 
The short rib tacos came out cold but 2 orders were taken off the bill which was very nice of the manager. 
Give it some time and hopefully they'll find out what a real lobster roll is!

This place was okay! Went here for a comped dinner before going into XS. I believe the old restaurant here used to be a burger place??

This is an American restaurant that triples their prices because it's in the Wynn... Duhhhh obvi. I was looking at their menu for a price range and it was your basic 10$ for vegetables, 30$ for a few pieces of shrimp ETC... So not that bad.

We tried the cheese and meat plate, and kale salad for appetizer. Then for dinner: baked chicken on green beans, tomato cheese rice, steak for entrees. We also got ONE free Moscow mule. No dessert unfortunately. Everything was delicious and made with superb quality. Everything didn't wow me but it was delicious and piping hot! 

Our server wasn't very friendly though, she acted like we were a burden because we were a comped table... Does she not know us industry people tip out extremely well? She even tried to charge us for a drink we didn't order thinking it was a mixed drink because the restaurant ran out of copper mugs.

This place was absolutely phenomenal from the service to the drinks to the food! Everything was wonderful! All The staff were just great friendly very welcoming! Our server Joshua was awesome best waiter we have ever had literally!! So accommodating he knew the menu extremely well helped us make out delicious selections. Please try the moscow  mule! This drink was heavenly tasting so light and fruity and refreshing and just strong enough! The food WOW everything we had from the appetizer to the entree to dessert just delicious chef was great! Highly recommend this place!

Excellent spot for breakfast. I had an omelette and side of bacon. Service was great and ambiance was very nice. I thought the portion size would be small, but it was not at all. Hash brown potatoes are excellent, kind of rolled into a square or ball. I highly recommend coming here for breakfast or brunch. Coffee was excellent as well. It was not busy, but suggest a reservation. Also, the food is pricey, but should be expected given it is in Encore.

What a nice brunch spot! Everything is so nice and neat. Service was great. Food tasted really good. Just thought the line was a little weird. We put down our name and how many people but we continued to stand in line. Didn't understand why we couldn't go anywhere else. But overall loved the food and how they made the Bloody Mary infront of us on a cart.

At Wynn and decided to try the new restaurant Jardin. First off the room looks great, lots of flowers and great views of the pools and outside. Society was so dark and gaudy with patio furniture. 
We checked in -the hostess was very nice.
We decided to try the Moscow mule cart- very cool! 
Service went smooth our waiter was very attentive.
We ordered the octopus and the yellowtail flowed by the salmon and the cioppino.
The octopus was the best I've ever had!  The salmon and cioppino tasted great and were cooked perfectly. 
We finished off with the flower pot cake- wow. Very unique and tasted great! 
Looking forward to our next trip there.

This place would've gotten a solid 3.5-4 had the service been better.  I ordered the eggs benedict, which was a little runnier than I'd like.  I prefer the whites fully cooked and the yellow soft.  I don't enjoy the texture of runny white. 

The hollandaise wasn't spectacular.  I ordered the fruit instead of the hash brown which was just a block.  It seemed like a creative attempt but it did not deliver.  The food itself, was good.  I enjoyed it. 

Our table wanted mimosas for the brunch so they said they'll send over the drink cart.  The drink cart was unattended for most of it. No one came by.  The table requested this 3x during the entire meal and no one came by.  Even getting our waitress was impossible.

She was missing and the restaurant was not busy.  After we were done, the drink cart came by and asked what we wanted and sounded surprised when we said, we don't want anything, we're done with the meal.  

From the service I received, I believe that management has not kept an eye on the employees and the employees have excelled in lagging or abiding their time during work.  Responsiveness was terrible and there must be some secret room where they all disappear to so they can't even be called on by us.

Very nice brunch place. The inside area as well as the outside area by the pool are both good.

The truffle pizza was excellent !! The vegan cauliflower wrap is super too.

Got a comped dinner before heading to XS Night Club. We each received a moscow mule before dinner. The food was so good! They gave us a variety of dishes. The service was excellent! I will definitely be returning. :)

Waiter was great. Very on top of everything. Managers left a lot to be desired. Food was overpriced and lacking in flavor. Ordered a drink on the rocks. Very little ice. Most of it melted before it arrived. Served soup with no spoon. It was cold by the time I got the spoon. Lots of choices on the strip. Skip this place and check out the ones across the street.

Servers were extremely polite and helpful. Very attentive. We thought the food was great - ordered the short rib with polenta entree, meat and cheese board, short rib burger, and a side of truffle fries to share. I would honestly rate everything a 9-10/10 on the taste level. The truffle fries were great and the burger was awesome. Pepper jack cheese, short ribs, crispy onion strings, and such great flavor. 

A bit annoying that the burger came a la carte - which is why I ordered the truffle fries to share. 

Desserts didn't seem so appealing although I did see a few people ordering the extravagant banana split and the flower pot dessert (for the taste, or the instagram, I'm not sure)

Sitting outside as beautiful even in December!!!! Inside looked beautiful as well with a beautiful flower vase 

The reason for the 4 star review is the hostesses. We asked how long the wait was for a table for 3 and she told us it would be 25 minutes. Looking around I noticed the tables were not full, the place was not busy, and that she had to have lied. She said there was a bunch of reservations however even seated, I saw not too many people coming in. My parents initially asked how long. I couldnt believe that it would be 25 and went to speak to her myself. She sat me right away! 

Dont know if she had anything against my parents but I felt extremely disrespected and so did my family.

I came here for lunch and drinks with my Mom during our stay at the Wynn. I had the grilled cheese with tomato soup, which was to die for!! I'm drooling thinking about it right now. The tomato soup was creamy and thick, tangy and delicious. The grilled cheese was done on sourdough. The cheese was perfectly melted and the bread nicely browned. So good. 

The drinks were top notch. I had the Vanilla Rose cocktail first. It was nicely presented with a flower, and was the perfect balance of sweet and sour. I also had the red sangria, which was huge (like the size of my head) and pretty boozy. I was into it. 

The restaurant is bright and beautiful too. The one thing I would note is the service isn't great. Our server was busy talking to other servers, and was pretty slow. It wasn't so bad that it ruined the lunch, but could definitely use some improvement.

A true find. Remarkably attentive and knowledgeable waitstaff. They seem to know everyting on the menu including the wines. Mary's chicken was a tasty and reasonable. Served with brussel sprouts and mashed potatoea-- comfort food! Not overpriced like the other Wynn restaurants.

Food is ok but service just horrible.
I don't order a menu with wine pairing if the pairing wine arrive after I finish my course. So many other basic mistakes like that all dinner long...yes sorry you failed, won't come back here

Jardin is a very nice restaurant located inside Encore.
Things to try.
Popcorn Chicken, Grandmothers Chicken Meatballs, Truffle Pizza, Green Pizza, Bigeye Tuna Poke, Organic Salmon, Caramelized Chicken Ravioli, Braised BBQ Short Ribs, Truffle Fries and Fork Mashed Potatoes. Good food nice atmosphere and of course class. Give them a shot.
Relaxed but lively atmosphere with great good. Service was friendly however pretty slow. Recommend the charred octopus and mac and cheese (side).

I had the opportunity to enjoy a nice meal at Jardin.  This restaurant had great views of the pool at Encore and has a lot of great ambiance.

I really enjoyed their appetizers and highly recommend the buffalo cauliflower as a healthy and light choice.  It's quite spicy but the cauliflower is cooked perfectly and I could eat a whole plate of it with no guilt.  The meatball appetizer was also high quality.

I enjoyed the "organic" salmon, although it isn't wild caught.  Overall, great service and great food mean a great meal.

The food here is excellent, but the service (at least at the bar), could use some help. I came in twice last Saturday, both before and after going to Encore Beach Club. I first came in around 1pm to meet a girlfriend, who had been waiting for me at the bar for a good 10-15 minutes, and she was still waiting to place her drink order. We ended up eventually ordering a drink and chatting for a bit before the pool. After leaving the pool we were hungry so we decided to go back to the bar to order some food. Like I said our food was great, but the service wasn't great, I'll just leave it at that. My guess is they were going through a shift change. Anyway my smoked salmon and beet salad was excellent and so were the french fries and broccolini. They also had some amazing gluten free bread, which I've never had before, but my friend is gluten free so I tried it and I absolutely loved it. I definitely want to eat here again, but I'll probably sit at a table next time.

Came here for my Bday dinner and my friend told the host it was my Bday twice. She then also mentioned it to the waitress. Our waitress was kinda slow & didn't really check on us. When our dessert came, We expected a candle or something or some kind of Bday acknowledgement.... but nope... nothing...and of course we're not gonna ask for it. Food was mediocre and price was reasonable. The decor and ambience was nice. Just a lil disappointed with the service. Probably won't be back.

The current review is for dinner. The last review was for brunch. Wine for dinner was lovely, a Malbec. Yet, food was just OK. I ordered many small dishes including their yellowtail tartare, Burrata, beet salad with smoked salmon,kale salad, and octopus grilled. All entrées were good with the kale salad being the best of them all. 
For entrées, we ordered the short rib ravioli and a tofu with mushroom and Asian noodles. The tofu with mushroom dish, which is vegan, was outstanding, with phenomenal spices and a lovely overall presence. The ravioli was boring and a little too sour due to some strange sauce on top of it and it just was anything but impressive. Honestly, the best part of the meal was the pretzels that came at the beginning which are equivalent to a bread basket. The downside was they had a horse radish like butter that I did not enjoy but the pretzel sticks were so good that all else did not matter. 
Therefore, it was only a three star experience and food is just OK.
Very expensive. $125 per person with tax which counts a bottle of wine for 2, A few appetizer dishes, and two entrées. No dessert as way too full.

I had been wanting to try Jardin's buttermilk chicken sandwich and finally had a chance to recently.  We came here for lunch at noon and there was plenty of seating available.  We chose to sit outside by the pool, though inside had the beautiful floral display in the middle of the restaurant.  It was a little bit cold but I made sure to get seated by a heat lamp.  Our party of 3 sat at a table for 6, so we each got to sit on the side of the table facing the pool area which was very nice.

I was underwhelmed by my sandwich.  I think I would have been happier with a fast food chicken sandwich :p  The taste of the cole slaw was pretty overpowering.  I also wasn't wowed by their strawberry smoothie nor their chocolate cake dessert - both were just ok and pretty pricey.  The cake was very Instagram-worthy though :p  It looked just like a flower in a pot and was 100% edible.   The menu said it serves 2-3, but it was more like 4-6.  

Service all around was meh from the moment we arrived and I was not crazy about how they allowed smoking at the restaurant.  But, it was nice out on their patio and they played some good music - thumbs up to "Tell Me" by Groove Theory and "Rock With You" by MJ!  FYI, most people seemed to be dressed up even for lunch but you'll still be seated even if you're not in a snazzy outfit.

Hands down best breakfast anywhere on the Strip. This located in the Encore and it takes some effort to get there if you're not staying at the Wynn. My Wife and I stayed at Trump down the block though ate 75% of our meals at either the Wynn or Encore. Every meal eaten in either location was outstanding. The service at Jardin is not good and that is really too bad. I would venture to say it's bad. I hate having to wait for coffee refills and an absent server. The average breakfast tab will be $60 so for that price the service should be amazing. Food and view are excellent, service quite bad.

I had a lovely dining experience here! I was able to be seated right away without a reservation, the host and servers were all delightful and the food was excellent. I will definitely be back the next time I'm at Wynn!

Very nice, relaxed spot with outdoor garden style dining. An excellent choice at anytime but also if you want to come in for a mid afternoon snack/light bite. Highly recommend the buffalo cauliflower, meat & cheese board and truffle fries. Really friendly service!

Such a good part of the Vegas experience! I came here right before getting on my flight and it was such a nice way to end. They have an outdoor seating area which is where we sat. The food was clean, good portioned and delicious. I was definitely satisfied after!

Like most things at the Wynn & Encore, Jardin is an equal, meeting the tone of extraordinary set as the standard. 

We popped in for an afternoon cocktail before our flight. Having been Lakeside at Parasol Down a few times prior at Wynn, we wanted to see if Encore had something comparable. In steps Jardin. Although it looks over a pool area, not the lake. 

It's one of the more elegant restaurants I've been to in Las Vegas. Light, bright & airy with a keen aire of sophistication the ambiance is right on pace for what we were looking for. 

The bartenders were friendly, offered customized birthday ice cream to my amour (we declined), & generally took good care of us while we lingered, people watch & clearly snapped away photos. 

I Can't wait to come here & dine outside on the patio, this is a gorgeous restaurant.

Let me first state the positive about this lovely restaurant. The setting is beautiful. We were seated in the outdoor dining area and everything was lovely.
The problem, however, is with the service.
I appreciate that it was slow at 8 o'clock on a Friday morning. However it initially took some time for a server to greet us, maybe because we were seated outdoors.
Once we were seated we ordered our breakfast. My husband ordered the steak and eggs and I ordered the salmon and capers with the bagel. The food was amazing. The salmon plate was delicious. The salmon tasted fresh and the accompaniment of the cucumber and tomatoes were wonderful.
However, if The food hadn't been good there was no one around to tell. The servers were MIA for most of our breakfast. When I got up to find someone to give me a coffee cup , the manager was standing in the middle of the room on his cell phone texting. I literally stood in front of him and cleared my throat so he would stop texting and look up and talk to me. Now I can see if I was at Denny's, but this is in the middle of the Encore and I expected better service. When I told him I was looking for my server he told me that he sent her home because it was slow. That's great, but I still needed a coffee refill and some cream cheese.
I hope this was a one time thing and I would be willing to give Jardin's another chance to impress me with their service like I was with the food.

The service was slow.  We didn't know who the waiter was for a while.  They gave us the wrong menu to look at, they gave us the breakfast/ lunch menu during dinner.  The food was average and the medium steak was cooked rare.  Not worth coming here especially with so many great options in the area.

Staying in the hotel and came here for brunch. Being the Wynn, the scenery was beautiful but came with a long wait. All the staff were so attentive and accommodating. The only con was that the food didn't seem as hot and fresh as it could have been; it was probably sitting out for a while before getting to us.

Came here for breakfast and it is a beautiful restaurant in true Steve Wynn style. Like the rest of Wynn property, you just feel special being here.  

I just ordered the steel cut oatmeal but it was property good with a side of brown sugar, maple syrup and golden raisins.  The real star of breakfast was the coffee. Jardin knows what what good strong cup of coffee is all about. 

If staying at the Wynn, you can go wrong eating here but don't be shocked when the bill comes!  It was almost $20 for some oatmeal and a cup of fonte Wynn coffee.
Beautiful place. If you want to an amazing food in a high end restaurant, this is defiantly the place to go.

We came in on Sunday June 12th for Restaurant Week 2016 lunch.  Place seemed steady busy, took about 20 minutes to get a table for 2.

I saw each table sat after us get service from the waitstaff, except our table.  After about 30 minutes, I saw a hostess speak to a gentleman in a suit & point to our table.

The gentleman in the suit came to our table & stated he was sorry for the wait.  I said " Yes, it felt like we were forgotten about."    I can't even make up what he said next, " Well we have a small celebrity in the restaurant that is more important." He then realized what he said quickly & flustered to correct his statement.

Our food did not come out in a timely fashion, again seeing tables sat after us getting their food.

When the gentleman in the suit came to our table to bring food, I asked if he was the manager, & he stated he was. I then asked him who the celebrity was & he told me Ciara & where she was sitting. Wow, I was floored, he spilled the information without blinking an eye.

Needless to say, our lunch & experience was not worth the $30.00 price tag.  Sad to come from such a high end hotel like Encore.  I am a local & really wanted to enjoy this place.

Loved this restaurant! The ambiance is beautiful.. the food was great. I got the chicken sandwich and my friend got the adult grilled cheese. Service was a little slow, waited a little long for the initial greet, but after that the server was very attentive. Price point is on the high side but what can you expect from a restaurant at the encore. Would definitely come back!

Pretty restaurant! We came here for brunch and our expectations were low due to the slightly empty restaurant. Looked over the menu and it had your standard brunch fare with a few unique items. My friend got the chicken and waffles, and I the lemon ricotta pancakes. Both portions were decent and very good! The chicken was moist and juicy and seasoned well! Sorta pricey but that's understandable in a Vegas casino. Now I want to come back to try the dinner items!

Came here twice. One night for drinks and one day for breakfast. Both times I have been here was great. Service was fast and very good. I love the breakfast here. I ordered steak and eggs which was I exactly wanted. It came with perfectly cooked hash browns and choice of bread. The steak was cooked perfectly and just the right portion for what I wanted for breakfast. Not too big and not too small. BUT don't expect this to be cheap because this is in between Encore and Wynn. Would definitely come back here again for drinks before going to Surrender and for breakfast and get the steak and eggs.

Another pay alot for mediocre food restaurant, the Buffalo cauliflower where nasty, greasy and not cryspy, definatly will not get those again. The short ribs ravioli were ok nothing special,the wife had the baked prawns and we split the Margherita flat bread... more like tortilla than flat bread, she was not impressed , i give it two stars because service was decent and people were friendly or else it would of been 1 star.

Wow this place is fantastic! Really a top notch dining experience, without long waits or extremely large prices. We had quite a bit of different options and everyone loved their food. I had the salmon and it was amazing, I also hear the pork chops, filet mignon, fried chicken, mac n cheese, and house salads were amazing. After they take your order, they bring you out some fresh pretzels bread sticks with a mustard seed butter, and that is just enough to get your taste buds watering for dinner.

Their drinks? So Many great choices. Try one of their moscow mules, they have a whole specialty bar cart to come around to make you your perfect mule! I promise it won't disappoint. 

The service was great, we interacted with a few and everyone was welcoming and patient. They also were mindful of when we needed to get going to be at our show on time. (Le Reve, check it out!)

We were not able to check out their brunch, but I hear it's pretty nice!

Lovely restaurant. I was looking forward to having a nice meal. After waiting 15 minutes at my table not a single person bothered to see if I needed anything or was ready to order. It was not terribly busy , so there is no excuse for ignoring a single diner. Very disappointing!.. Decided to leave without trying the meal. Did not try the food but the service left a bad taste .

I have eaten here on several occasions. Jardin is a great replacement to what was Botero; the day people sculptures there always kept me away. 

The reviews are accurate in that service has always been slow, and it's difficult to get a server if you need something quickly, but besides that the food is really good, and the decor is somewhat refreshing. I do enjoy eating here, and have only had the "brunch foods" all have been really good.

We've eaten here twice and they were very accommodating with our needs. The food is wonderful and the service is very Wynn. Attention to detail, comfortable seating and an intimate feel about it. I will return, as I am a regular at this property.

I am on the Wynn and Encore properties at least once a week for business and for leisure.

I make Jardin my go-to breakfast or lunch spot because there is no other restaurant in town that understands or approaches complete breakfast/lunch service like Jardin. 

The General Manager, Brooke, and her amazing staff work well with the Chef and the back of the house to create an amazing dining experience. 

The hostess staff is pleasant and accommodating, the service is amazing and the food is top flight. The venue is down right gorgeous.
Great food...  Terrible service...  Be prepared to wait a long time for food.  As I'm typing, my husband is pulling hair out of his Avocado Toast.  Sorry!!!  High hopes dashed.
The food is incredible. The only downfall less of a 5 star was the service. It took the waiter 15 min to come over just to give out dinner menus. We were stated with just drink menus.

We tried Jardin for breakfast and we weren't disappointed. The hostesses were friendly as they led us to the table. It was really nice in the restaurant but not over the top. There is a large case in the center with silk flowers and a ring on the ceiling above. It was pretty, but not elegant in my opinion. 

The server came right over, got us water and coffee stat. Our orders were taken in a reasonable amount of time and our food was out in 10-15. It filled up shortly after we got in. 

My chicken and waffles consisted of a large, breaded chicken tender and a piece of French toast with a Frosted Flakes type breaking and a sunny side egg in the middle. There was no waffle. I don't know why they call it chicken and waffles, but it was really good none-the-less. The French toast was very nice and flavorful. My hubby had eggs benedict  and said it was "pretty good." 

Nice and simple and close to the room. You don't have to go out in 111 degree weather.

So i came here for dinner. The service was outstanding and top notch. The food portions are very small but it is a high end type of restaurant. 

We started with a arugula salad: very fresh and delicious. Next i had some kind of bread with pork belly avocado and a few other things on top. It was awesome i never had something like that before. We drank moscow miles with everything! Easily one of the best mules i've ever had but it wasn't too strong. 

Next we had salmon which was hot and crispy omg he outside. The dip it came with was good too. Last we have a small piece of steak: very well cooked and crispy on the outside. i love when the food comes burning hot it's really so important! 

Last i had the banana bread pudding and signature pot dessert. Both were UHHHAMAAZZZINNG! Check out my awesome pics!

First time at jardins and was very impressed by the service decor and most important the food. Made reservations for brunch and was seated right away. Loved everything about this place and would definitely be back for dinner.

Restaurant had nice decor and polite wait staff but the food was VERY disappointing. We went there for breakfast and were excited  to finally get a good meal but instead were greeted with burnt coffee and barely edible eggs benedict. The Hollindaise sauce tasted like mayonnaise, the ham was dry and the cost was high. I wouldn't dine here again.

Jardin,

Four of us had a royal breakfast here. We relished every bit of it, awesome.
I had a couple of breakfasts here several years ago when Encore was first built. This time, third time, it was a charm. I had 2 glasses of fresh squeezed green juice. It was so refreshingly pleasing to my taste buds; I was tempted to have several more glasses. We pretty much randomly picked various dishes. All of the dishes were so tasty, wowing all 4 of us.

The waitress was cheerful, eager to serve, and actually listening and accommodating whatever whims we had. She even spread jam on the left-over bread that we wanted to take out, truly above and beyond.

We were seated right next to the centerpiece of "royal" bouquet, humongous and grandiose and still very elegant.

We paid $200 for 4 of us, a bit pricey, but we still felt real good; worth every penny it was.

Instead of the long lines at Wynn breakfast buffet, this is now officially our favorite poolside breakfast nook in Vegas.
Sehr gutes amerikanisches Frühstück in hellem angenehmen Ambiente. Zum Frühstücken, wenn man im Wynn wohnt ideal.

we had a large party and the staff was excellent.  they have a prix fix which I would recommend.  Portions are quite large and the deserts are excellent.  I had salmon but if I were to order it again I would ask for it simply grilled as the sauce was a little over-powering.  It is a very beautiful place and elegant in a casual way.

If you're looking for a place to dine before going out to XS, this is a good go to spot. We went here for a birthday/bachelorette celebration with 9 girls total. Tip: make reservation especially for big parties. As far as the food I'm impressed how tasty everything was. We had some pizza, popcorn chicken, pesto pasta. And my favorite thing was their complimentary pretzel!

Came here for a friend's b day dinner. Currently writing this review as I wait for my server to pick up the payment for my check... it that's any hint as to how bad the service was, considering I have time to write it.  The food was DECENT, at that. The vibe and environment is beautiful. But NOT worth the prices at all. And not to mention, our service was incredibly SLOW, when our server was NOT busy. It's a Tuesday night. We had to ask for things several times before receiving. The whole table was almost finished eating before the birthday guy's food came out because our server never came back to check on us to know it was missing. We were here for TWO hours. 1 person ordered a drink, the rest of us has water, no appetizers or desert and this still took this long. It sucks when you pay a large amount for crappy service and sub par food..... Don't waste your time!

This was a very nice, quiet, elegant place to stop in for lunch!. Most of the people were seated outside (which there was a 25-30 min wait for), so we chose to sit inside, in which they offered us a window seat. The staff was very nice and we were seated pretty much right away for our 3:30 reservation. Bailey was our waitress and she was amazing!  Gf and I both ordered the sangria (which was sooooo good and refreshing). Upon getting the drink however, it had blueberries in it (which I'm a allergic to, and they replaced it with no hassle. 

For lunch, I ordered the jardin burger, which was excellent. Juicy, with the porkbelly on top with the aoli sauce. Just perfect, and a side of fries. My gf got the margarita pizza, which was good as well. 

Overall this place has a vibe that combines the elegance of a Sunday brunch with the cool & chill atmosphere. Would definitely come back. The floral center decoration in the middle of the restaurant just brings it all together.

The most impressive thing about this restaurant is the decor. Beautifully decorated, swanky bar, eye catching touches everywhere but unfortunately, that's where it ends. Everything is else is lackluster. 

The service isn't good. They all look like they'd rather be somewhere else. Our busser was more attentive than our waiter. He never delivered the dishes or checked on our food but he popped up every 30 seconds to pick up the signed check. For these prices you would think they would bring it with either service or food but the food was pretty average too. It reminds me of a high end cafe. I had a three course meal and there isn't one thing that stood out. The beet salad was blah and our apple crostata came with no ice cream and was so thick all you tasted was dough. When you're not delicate or rush pastry, it shows. I think the most disappointing part of our meal was having to eat around cigarette smokers on nearby tables (using the restaurant cups for ashtrays). It's gross having someone blow smoke when you're trying to take a bite and I don't know if it was allowed but no staff said anything and they were very aware of it. Judging by the loud EDM music, I think they are trying to cater to a younger, club crowd. Awkward for families and a romantic date.

This place was bomb. Came for a pre fixe dinner with girlfriends - we had table apps, a toast, entree, and table dessert for $60 each plus tip. Of the appetizers, the tuna poke was my favorite, really delicious. I was not as impressed with the bitter salad. The entrees we got, salmon and filet, were absolutely amazing. I was so impressed with the way that they were cooked and prepared. Dessert was pretty good, but by then I was so stuffed that I didn't fully appreciate it. The other stand out is service - our server was so attentive and very friendly, got every aspect of the order right, and managed to serve us well without imposing. It was a really great experience in Vegas.

Never again! I came to Jardin with 4 other ladies on 08/19 during my sister's bachelorette weekend in Vegas. We were going to XS later that night and wanted to have a nice dinner before hand. The main reason we chose Jardin is because it is close to the club and beautiful but the service we received was an absolute joke! 

Our server came by and said hello and then we didn't see her for almost 20 minutes. Meanwhile other servers are hanging around our table noticing us looking for our server and not one of them came to check on us. When our server finally came back she simply said, "Sorry I had to step off the floor". So my first question is why didn't you let us know that or send someone to check on us? It's not like we went a cheap diner! This place is upscale so the guests should be treated that way. 

Our food took FOREVER to come out. I realize it was a Saturday night but again the server never came and checked on us and the restaurant honestly looked like it was dead. Once the food finally arrived we were so disappointed. Luckily we were snacking throughout the day so we only ordered small meals because the food was just alright and the drinks were mediocre as well. The presentation was fabulous but the taste...not so much.

After we had finished with our food it took our server another 10 years to finally check on us and my sister in law asked her very nicely for our check and she asked if she could please split them. This server looked at my sister in law and said (with a TON of attitude) "all 5?! Ugh just give me 2 minutes". About 10 minutes laster she returned with checks, slammed them down in front of each of us and said, "thanks" under her breath as she was walking away. 

At this point we were upset and wanted to speak with a manager. I have friends that are servers and I even worked in a restaurant for a short while myself so I completely understand that not every table can be pampered and that splitting checks can be a pain but with that being said this place was not cheap and the service we received was terrible. The manager came over and our server made sure to be very close pretending to do stuff so she could listen in to our complaints. All the manager said was "I'm sorry for your experience let me get your checks". After another 10 minutes goes by the server (yes, the one we had a bad experience with) came back with our checks and said very sarcastically "I'm sorry for you bad experience, the manager took $5 off your meals". 

Why would they send the server who we complained about to give us our checks? Also it is nice that the manager took some money off of our meals but honestly $5 off at a place as expensive as Jardin is more of a slap in the face than an apology. We were not looking to get anything discounted or free but we wanted management to know about our experience so hopefully their future guests have a better time and the half hearted apology we received along with the $5 off seemed like they were just trying to get us out the door. Overall I was truly disappointed that our final dinner for my sister's bachelorette party was ruined by the horrible service and treatment we received from Jardin, I highly recommend anyone who is considering to eat here to turn the other way. Although the ambience and appearance of this place is fabulous everything else was subpar.

I don't post much, but this place moved me to. I cannot say enough good things! From being greeted at the door, to our server being one of the most fun and attentive we have ever had, and then a visit from the GM who was one of the most engaged managers I have ever seen. She moved from table to table with a huge smile, engaging people and joining in the service. My recommend - chicken and waffles and chilaquiles are awesome!!

We booked for stay at Wynn Encore at same time made reservation at Jardin before we left Hawaii since this was a new restaurant.
We weren't disappointed with our breakfast meal of Veggie Frittata made to perfection bacon crisp, service was exceptional as usual at Wynn and decor with real flowers.
We'll be back again tomorrow.
